characters: AS IF AN INVISIBLE FORCE IS PULLING HER BACKWARDS
THEN A HIGH PITCHED SOUND INTERRUPTS THE SONG
A WAVE OF CONFUSION RUSHES THROUGH THE CLASSROOM
THE TWO BEAMS OF LIGHT SPOT THE WAY THROUGH THE DARKNESS.
THE GIRLS HEAR THE SPRINGS IN THE COUCH GROAN AS MR. JENS
HE STEPS OVER THE EDGE AND FREE FALLS
WE SEE KATIE PASS IN THE DISTANCE
TYPED WORDS APPEAR ON A GLOWING SCREEN 10
BUT THE IMAGE ON HER PHONE SHOWS
THE VIDEO EXPANDS AUTOMATICALLY, FILLING THE ENTIRE SCREE
WE SEE SHE IS ALONE NOW. HALLIE IS GONE
AND TIE, STARING FROM A HORRIBLY BLANK, FEATURELESS FACE
A TALL THIN FIGURE STEPS OUT OF THE HOUSE, TENTACLE
SUDDENLY, THE DEN DOOR KNOB JIGGLES
THE SCREAM EVOLVES INTO VOICES THAT SOUND EERILY FAMILIAR
EVERY FLUORESCENT FIXTURE ABOVE INSTANTLY BLAZES WITH LIG
WREN AND HALLIE TEAR OFF THEIR BLINDFOLDS
THEN SHE HEARS SOMETHING IN THE BRUSH
SUDDENLY THAT HIGH PITCHED SOUND AGAIN
THE AIR AROUND HIM LIKE TENTACLES.
SOMETHING SLIDES OUT IN FRONT OF HER
BUT TO CHASE AFTER THEIR FRIEND..
ONLY TO SEE HER PARENTS COME IN. AND THE ROOM AROUND HER
TYPED WORDS APPEAR ON A GLOWING SCREEN 12
CHLOE RIPS THE GAUZE FROM HER FACE
FOR A MOMENT SHE CAN'T STOP SCREAMING
AS SOON AS SHE SPEAKS THE WORDS, DARK TENTACLES CRAWL DOW
THE LIGHTS SHORT OUT IN SEQUENCE, THE DARKNESS WORKING IT
NOW A FLOOR BOARD CREAKS IN THE LIVING ROOM
THE FINAL CALL. A DEEP, LOW, TONE OSCILLATES AND ECHOES
THE DARK FIGURE STANDS RIGHT BEHIND HER IN THE REFLECTION
VOICES OF LOST CHILDREN SWIRLING AND CRYING FOR HELP
THEN A FAINT MURMUR COMES FROM THE WOODS
WHEN A CHIME SHATTERS THE SILENCE
HER ARM IS BUBBLED OVER WITH LESIONS
THE GIRLS TURN TOWARDS THE SOUND AND SOMEHOW THEY ARE RIG
THE LONG, THIN SHADOW FLOATS INTO VIEW. SLITHERING ACROSS
HER EYELIDS OPEN. BUT THERE ARE NO EYES. ONLY BUGS
SUDDENLY, A FLURRY OF IMAGES ON THE SCREEN
THE LIBRARIAN'S CART TUMBLES TO THE FLOOR IN FRONT OF HER
WAY ACROSS THE ROOM... TOWARDS WREN
SLITHERING AROUND HIM. HIS BLANK FACE STARING.
JUST LINES OF SHELVES LEADING INTO DARKNESS
HER. HER EYES DARTING AROUND THE ROOM, SEARCHING...
A LONG, FAINT CHIME RESONATES, CARRYING OUT FROM SOMEWHER
THEN ANOTHER MURMUR FROM THE WOODS
THE WALLS LIKE BLACK VEINS SPIDER-WEBBING IN ALL DIRECTIO
THE ARMS UNFOLDING LIKE PETALS OF A BLACK FLOWER. HOVERIN
A BRANCH BREAKS AND FALLS TO THE GROUND AND CHLOE CHARGES
WHO GIVES A SHIT ABOUT TOM
AND SHE IS ABSORBED BY THE FIGURE DROPPING DOWN FROM ABOV
CHLOE HOLDS THE SCALPEL UP TO HER EYE
FRIGHTENED VOICES CRY OUT FROM THE CROWD
A SCREAM COMES OVER THE LINE
CHLOE POPS UP IN THE WINDOW RIGHT ABOVE THEM
FLOOR. IT BENDS INTO AN IMPOSSIBLE SHAPE AS IT ROLLS UP T
HALLIE GASPS AS A BLINDING LIGHT EXPLODES ALL AROUND HER
CRICKETS STOP CHIRPING. THE LEAVES STOP RUSTLING. DEAD QU
SUDDENLY, KATIE ARCHES BACKWARDS AND A SOUND COMES OUT OF
WALL. AT ANY MOMENT IT WILL ROUND THE CORNER
THEY HEAR THE FLOOR CREAK OUTSIDE THE DOOR
A RAPID-FIRE SERIES OF CLASS PHOTOS
SHE REACHES THE END OF THE AISLE AGAIN
CUT TO ANOTHER PART OF THE WOODS
BLACK SUIT WITH A FACE THAT IS A FRANCIS BACON BLUR--
HER MISSING EYES ARE NOW DEEP CRIMSON XS OF SCARRED TISSU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANNING OVER GIRLS’ STUFF abandoned on dead grass. GIRL’S VOICE #1 (0.S.) They left things in the clearing and walked into the trees. Holding hands...

dialogues.speaker: A TITLE CARD APPEARS
dialogues.text: We keep panning over the discarded items. A journal, a ph inexpensive jewelry, a bedazzled cellphone... But each item is either ripped or smashed.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS VIDEO
dialogues.text: POLICE search with dogs. ONE OF THE POLICEMEN holds up a TEDDY BEAR. Torn in half... BOY’S VOICE #1 (0.S.) All the girls were like totally normal. None of them was on drugs or anything. One of them was like a Girl Scout. Or Explorer Scout. Or something like that...

dialogues.speaker: A RAPID-FIRE SERIES OF CLASS PHOTOS
dialogues.text: TEENAGED GIRLS' faces. Some freckled, most smiling. GIRL’S VOICE #2 (0.S.) Jennifer, Ellen, Allison, Carly, Rebekah, Margo, Kylie...

dialogues.speaker: ON VIDEO 4
dialogues.text: A CHEERLEADER talks directly into her Web Cam.

dialogues.speaker: CHEERLEADER
dialogues.text: The school library burned down the same day. It was pretty freaky. Some pretty mysterious shit.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 2.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS FOOTAGE 5
dialogues.text: POLICE and FIREMEN mill about a smoldering structure. A s standing sign says: CUMBERLAND HIGH SCHOOL LIBRARY.

dialogues.speaker: ON VIDEO 6
dialogues.text: A BOY WITH GLASSES talks to his Web Cam.

dialogues.speaker: BOY WITH GLASSES
dialogues.text: I just can’t see a natural fire burning that hot. The walls were melted. I bet the only place anybody'd ever seen anything like that was in Hiroshima.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same burned structure. WORKERS sift through the ashes A FIREMAN, standing amid the charred ruins of the library holds up an intact SURVEILLANCE CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: SURVEILLANCE VIDEO
dialogues.text: Black and white footage of the girls walking from the clearing into the woods. GIRL’S VOICE #3 (0.S.) People said they heard screams. Coming from the woods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow a GIRL through waist-high sunflowers. GIRL’S VOICE #4 (0.S.) But Allison Riley wasn’t like the others. She came back... Allison staggers slightly.

dialogues.speaker: BOY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: The cop who found her said she was holding something. Turned out it was... Viewed from the front, Allison is holding something. She raises her eyes toward us. And opens her hands. As if offering what's in them. Some bloody mess of something...  10 11 12 13 14 15 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 3.

dialogues.speaker: TYPED WORDS APPEAR ON A GLOWING SCREEN 10
dialogues.text: One letter at a time: "Her own tongue.”

dialogues.speaker: SURVEILLANCE VIDEO
dialogues.text: Filmed through safety glass inset in a door. The girl, Allison, has a haunted look on her face. GIRL’S VOICE #5 (0.S.) They gave her a piece of paper and asked her to write down what happened. But she only wrote one word...

dialogues.speaker: TYPED WORDS APPEAR ON A GLOWING SCREEN 12
dialogues.text: One letter at a time: “Him.”

dialogues.speaker: FROZEN IMAGE
dialogues.text: Of the girls walking into the woods. PUSH IN to the background on a dark aberration. Blurred and out of focus incomprehensible human shape. Hideously tall and thin. Featureless. Disproportionately arms extending downwards. A terrifying, faceless figure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON VIDEO: A cat dances while wearing shades and a bow-tie This is on a cell in the hand of HALLIE, 17, fit and athletic. Hair pulled back in a pony tail. A lively spark Hallie’s eyes quickly evolves into a brilliant smile. She leans over and replays the video for KATIE, 17, sitti next to her in the bleachers. Unlike Hallie, she doesn’t the part in a “Massachusetts Charter” P.E. uniform. Katie draws her hair back and stares at the screen. The d old eyeliner around her eyes was left on intentionally. A tiny act of defiance.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 4.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: It'd be better if he didn't have the bow-tie. A quirky little grin flashes across Katie’s face.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: It'd be better if he exploded at the end.

dialogues.speaker: P.E. TEACHER
dialogues.text: (calling from the field) Katie, you're up! Katie brazenly ignores him. Hallie gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Whatever. He'll give up after a second. He doesn't really want me having a heart attack on his field. The P.E. Teacher indeed moves on. Hallie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I'm forwarding this to Wren...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WREN, 17, talks to her very PATIENT TEACHER having his sa lunch. Her carefully disheveled bob and retro-cool glasse lend her a unique and clever sense of style. High school posh with a Euro flair makes sure she sticks

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about my short story collection. I'm thinking maybe it's a novel. Wren looks at her phone. Sees the video link from Hallie. Watches and texts back: Groovy.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course, when I'm published my mother will hire someone to kill me. There are things in there she doesn't know I know. Things her theater friends in Berlin told me. They were shocked and Berliners don't shock easily... Do you know the city?  17 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 5.

dialogues.speaker: PATIENT TEACHER
dialogues.text: (tolerant) I've never been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIDS hover in the hallway. Wren, Hallie and Katie come al Out of her gym clothes, Katie's look is edgier than the others. Buckled and worn leather boots and jeans. A scree printed heart with large black wings spread across her fa and ragged out t-shirt. They see CHLOE (17). Alert, pretty. She makes her way ove adjusting her sweater.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Nice sweater...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Katie! Hallie tries to come to the rescue, but Chloe can stand u for herself.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I got it at Tilly's. It’s in all the magazines... The girls keep walking. Chloe falls in with them.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: It's YOUR life. We can only offer guidance.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Eat me, bitch. The girls laugh as they near a group of BOYS. Wren lowers her voice, in a mock-British accent-

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Just ahead, the Dude-Bro in his natural habitat. Let's observe, shall we? Hallie laughs at Wren's little remark as they skirt the e of the boys. But when her chuckle's over, Hallie looks ba and sees TOM (17).  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 6. He’s tall, clean cut, and flanked by “bro”-type buddies. his broad, sleepy-eyed smile and gentle disposition sets apart from the rest. Casually, he glances in Hallie’s direction. She thinks he’s hailing her. She opens her mouth to say "Hey" back. But embarrassingly it’s a false alarm. Hallie awkwardly covers her mistake b rubbing her nose. Wren observes all and shakes her head. To add to Hallie's embarrassment, Wren calls out...

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey Tom, what's the plan tonight? Tom smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: BIG plans-- But one of the boys, A BURLY KID with a Red Sox cap interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: BURLY KID
dialogues.text: Hey! Top secret! Tom shrugs. Maybe even winks as the boys continue past. W turns laughing to Hallie.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Circle jerk? KYLE (17), slightly nerdy and definitely bookish, brings the rear. Not bad looking, but obviously the runt of the litter.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Hey, Chloe. He nods, falling just short of making effective eye conta Chloe smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: So, Kyle, what's the big secret?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I could tell you but I'd have to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Yeah?  19 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 7. Hallie rolls her eyes. The “End of the Day” bell rings.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I, for one, am intrigued but I've got to go get my sister. Hallie smiles and peels off. Chloe engages Kyle in furthe conversation. While Wren and Katie exchange amused looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family dinner time. Meet Hallie’s MOTHER and FATHER, 40s. sister, LIZZIE, a sweet 14-year-old mirror image of Halli

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S FATHER
dialogues.text: I bumped into Coach Sanders today. He said your 1600 meter time is really improving. All that training is paying off. Good job, honey. Hallie smiles. About to say thanks, but Lizzie interrupts

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: Did you tell them? Dolores Constantino quit the team... Hallie shoots Lizzie a look. HALLIE’S MOTHER Why?

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: She's pregnant. Hallie continues to glare at Lizzie: “Why bring that up?” Their mother internally “Tsk tsks...”

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: What does she imagine she'll do now?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: She wants to keep it. She's going to drop out and have the baby.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: 17-years-old? My God. It could end there but Hallie doesn’t like her mother’s t Decides to lob a grenade.  20 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 8.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Doesn't she have the right to? Hallie’s mother jumps on it.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: The question is, is it smart?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Smart isn't always what matters. Sometimes you have to do what you feel, even if it doesn't make sense. That's what it is to be a person, right? To have free will? A person has the right to say two plus two equals five. HALLIE’S MOTHER Okay, Dostoevsky. Hallie sighs in an irritated and overdramatic fashion. He mother lets it slide, but only for a moment. HALLIE’S MOTHER (CONT’D) So, I suppose WREN is going to be at Katie's tonight...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, so... HALLIE’S MOTHER So...I just noticed a change since you two started hanging out- Hallie glares at her. A stinger. Every teenager's super power. And as if on cue, the DOORBELL rings. INT. HALLIE’S HOUSE - ENTRYWAY -- MOMENTS LATER 20 Lizzie opens the door to let Wren in. She's obviously exc to see the older girl. Wren knows it and likes it.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: How you doin' kid?

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: (making sure her parents don't hear) I wore the t-shirt you gave me to school. I got sent to the principal's office.  21 22 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 9.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Well done. Hallie shakes her head as she grabs her coat. Playfully tweaks Lizzie's braid before she and Wren head out. Lizzi left just standing there. Wishing she could go, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie lets Hallie and Wren in.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Don't make any noise. “IT’S” dormant. Reveal KATIE’S FATHER, 40s. Ex-military but still sports crew-cut. He’s asleep on a couch in the living room. In f of an old movie. Vodka in evidence.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (resigned) Just another Friday night at the Jensen's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone bare bulb hangs from the ceiling. The warm pool of light casts shadows of scattered and forgotten belongings the dark recesses under the house. Rotting wooden posts struggle to support the floor above. Somewhere in the darkness, A TINY SIX-LEGGED CREATURE skitters across a spiderweb. He watches silently from a corner where the rafters meet. four girls lounge in recycled sofas and rescued furniture the belly of the room below. It’s a dark and dank little clubhouse, hidden away from t outside world.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Seriously, I think you and Karl will make an adorable couple.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: It’s Kyle. And I don't even like him...  Blue Rev. (06/09/16)

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Sure, sure. Like you don't wish you were there with him at their secret sausage fest right now.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: No, but... (beat) I do know what their big secret is.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Do tell.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: They're all getting together at Tom's house. In his garage to try to summon Slender Man. A heavy silence fills the room.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (mockingly) Creepy. Hallie studies the others, not quite grasping the

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What’s Slender Man?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: (to Hallie) The guy who makes kids disappear? Hallie doesn’t have a clue.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Wait. Why have I not heard of this?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: That’s a longer conversation... 10. situation. Hallie gives Wren the finger. Scopes her phone. Enters "Slender Man" in her search browser. FOOTSTEPS POUND THE FLOOR ABOVE THEM. It’s so loud they all flinch!! The girls sit frozen in place. Listening. Eyes following movement above. The light hanging over their heads sends dark shadows ove their eyes. Like they’re telling ghost stories by campfire.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) ll.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispers) What the hell is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Probably looking for another bottle. (child-like) "Daddy needs his medicine..." Hallie smiles at the joke and pops in her ear buds. We watch her click on a video link. - IN THE VIDEO: A long, slow PUSH-IN on a black and white image of a burned down library. Text scrolls up from belo - “IN THE SUMMER OF 2001, SEVEN GIRLS FROM THE TOWN OF CUMBERLAND, RHODE ISLAND WENT MISSING WITHOUT A TRACE.” Hallie can still hear the girls talking back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hate living here. All he does is drink, sleep, and shit. The girls laugh. Everyone but Hallie, focused on her phone. - The video continues to zoom in on the smoldering librar the text clears. Closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s just so much worse since my mom left-- THE FLOOR CREAKS ABOVE. Katie, Chloe, and Wren look up. Following with their eyes Hallie listens with them, still watching the image on her phone as it evolves into a dark indistinguishable shape. - Then four words surface in the center of the frame. -— “ONLY ONE CAME BACK...” Katie’s eyes drop to the floor as her father’s footsteps away and disappear.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sometimes I just wanna leave. You know?  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 12. She glances up, looking for comfort in her friends’ eyes.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: I have friends in Paris. We could stay with them.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (not looking up from her phone) What friends? You’ve never even been to Paris...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: My mom has friends there, idiot. WE HEAR MORE FOOTSTEPS CARRY THROUGH THE HOUSE. Katie looks to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Don’t I wish. I’m totally stuck in this shithole... Then something draws Hallie’s attention back to her phone - Out of nowhere, a LOW EERIE DRONE. It grows in Hallie’s ears until it drowns out the chatter in the room. Hallie looks over as the girls continue to discuss someth she can no longer hear. - ON THE SCREEN: Something seems to be taking form in the indistinct, shadowy regions of the grainy image. Hallie struggles to focus, pulling the screen closer. In this moment, it’s like the real world around her has decelerated. Almost paused, as the INTENSE LOW TONE HEIGH in Hallie’s ears. She stares at the mysterious, silent shape on screen. Unblinking. Straining to make sense of it. Until...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE SCREAMS
dialogues.text: Wren, Katie, and Chloe jump.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What the hell?!  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 13.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (laughing now) Oh my God. Look!

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What? The girls gather around now. Watching the same video of t burned library. Chloe reads from the screen, a haunting tone to her voice Getting into the moment.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: "In the summer of 2001, seven girls from the town of Cumberland, Rhode Island went missing without a trace..."

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: We can read.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Good for you. We watch in silence as the girls stare at the screen. The low drone intensifies. Warbling and over-modulating.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: This made you scream?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Wait. It’s coming up. The sound slowly dies out. Silence sets in around them as they huddle together in the center of the room. The tiny above keeps the darkness at bay as they focus on the phon

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispers) It was right after-

dialogues.speaker: THE SHRIEKING FACE
dialogues.text: They all jump as it leaps out at them. Then start laughin Katie snatches the phone. She backs up the video and free the frame. With the shrieking face frozen on screen, it becomes clea that it has been crudely digitally added to the still ima It's a girl. Eyes wide. Hair and face drenched in blood.  Tan Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 14.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: That's- you know who that is? From "Carrie"...

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: That is the girl from "Carrie."

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: That is patently the girl from "Carrie." Hallie averts her eyes, embarrassed. Wren’s judgmental comment clearly directed at her. Katie scrolls through more links. Clicks on another... ON THE SCREEN: Disturbing images of a tall, shadowed figu Slide through frame. Always alone. Watching. Waiting. Sta without eyes. Just a pale white, blank face... ...Like it’s been erased. - A human-like depiction of a figure wearing a black suit blood red tie. Sickly pale skin covers a featureless face - The hideously thin form lurks in a dark forest, its impossibly long arms reaching towards us. - Black tentacles spread from the back of another tall figure. They twist around his body on all sides. Face bla like the others. Its elongated arms hanging at its sides. Katie grabs her laptop now. Chloe continues reading from phone. Wren looks at her cell, too.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: "He preys upon innocent youth..."

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Sounds like my Uncle Herbert. The girls snicker as Chloe continues.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: “Slender Man is said to live ina hidden mansion, but the location is unknown...”

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Really? Is he single? Chloe cracks this time. She can’t help but laugh. +e HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 23 Tan Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 15.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Here it is! (looks up) “How To Summon Slender Man." A devious smile creeps across Wren’s face.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: We have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: We actually don’t. Actually...

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER 23
dialogues.text: A video is cued up on Katie’s laptop. A sparse web page w a generic black background. A foreboding play symbol wait patiently. One line of basic text reads... “How To Summon Slender Man” The girls gather around as if prepping the stage for some bizarre, ancient ritual. Hallie hits the lights.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Seriously, this feels like clicking on something really Russian and malware-y.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Don’t be such a pussy. Katie shoots her a look. Wren reaches in and clicks play on the laptop.

dialogues.speaker: THE VIDEO EXPANDS AUTOMATICALLY, FILLING THE ENTIRE SCREE
dialogues.text: - IT STARTS TO PLAY: Footage of A FOREST over a dead sile Almost a still image, but the mist slowly drifting betwee gives it away. A sinister glow from the screen up-lights the girls’ face they gaze into the display. Hypnotized. - Shots of ISOLATED LONELY TREES. Towering pillars that r into a darkened canopy. Twisted branches cutting through night sky.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 16.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Listen to this shit... (reading from her phone) “Those who hear the three bells toll, accept HIS invitation...When you hear the first you must close your eyes, keeping words unspoken... - On screen, eerie image after image repeat over and over Crooked trees separated by a dark void inside the forest.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If one wants to hear they must listen closely, for they are faint and distant. With eyes still closed and the mind wide open...clear your thoughts as you await the second... - An ever present fog, hides something from view. Somethi we can almost see. But the image keeps changing. Switchin another.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: +.-Only opening your eyes once you hear the third...” Chloe shakes her head, trying to make sense of it. The girls are spellbound, soaking in the pale glow from t screen. Except for Chloe who nervously laughs and backs a

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whatever...this is dumb- Wren pulls Chloe reluctantly back into the mix.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Chloe! Shut up... The girls return to the image on the screen, silence ring in their ears. An anxious tension as they hold their collective breath. Listening... Waiting...

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Very funny bitch. Knock it off.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 17. Now nervous laughter. Wren quickly shushes them. ON THE LAPTOP: We begin to hear the sound of trees creaki in the breeze. Wind rustling through branches. A moment later, very faintly...soft and far way... A BELL ECHOES IN THE FOREST. The girls look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (devious) Let’s do it. They all close their eyes, giggling. But Chloe pauses, gu shy. Wren nudges her and she follows along. Then a silent moment. We hear the girls breathe, waiting in the electric glow f the screen. ON THE LAPTOP: A SECOND FAINT BELL RESONATES, carrying ou from somewhere deep in the darkened woods on screen. With her eyes still closed, Chloe lets out an awkward lau

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Are you serious? This is so--

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER THREE
dialogues.text: (eyes closed)

dialogues.speaker: SHHH
dialogues.text: Chloe sighs in resignation and keeps her eyes shut. ON THE LAPTOP: The sound of the forest settles. A hushed stillness. We can hear the sounds of leaves landing softl the ground. LIKE TINY FOOTSTEPS IN THE DARKNESS... Then, barely audible, a low faraway tone. An unsettling hollow ring... - THE FINAL BELL TOLLS.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Do you guys hear that?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I think so.  24 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 18.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Maybe. I don’t know... They open their eyes as the sound slowly dies and fades a - ON THE SCREEN NOW: A static silhouette of a large, gnar and twisted oak tree. Branches reach out into the frame l tentacles winding their way out of its thick black trunk. The girls sit, eyes fixed, waiting for something to happe But nothing comes. - Just that ominous image of the towering oak tree starin back at them. Relentless...Unwavering... - Or is it? Is the tree moving? THE SCREEN SUDDENLY STROBES WITH IMAGES WE CAN’T MAKE OUT The girls shudder, shielding themselves. - Then the image cuts out. Just disappears. THE SCREEN GOES TOTALLY BLACK. A deafening silence as the girls sit frozen in the dark r Nobody speaks. Temporarily blind. The screen now blank. Chloe and Hallie look at each other, completely unnerved. Trying to shake off the mutually disturbing feeling.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What a stupid video... But Wren’s eyes give it away. She’s just as rattled and quickly clicks the lights on. The lone bulb above them wa away the darkness. The girls breathe easier now as they recover from the intense on-screen assault. Except for Katie. Who just sits there. Staring at the bla screen...

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Moonlight from a small basement window sketches outlines random junk in the room. We see the same tiny spider, spinning his web. Pausing occasionally to watch the girls who lay blanketed on couc cushions and cots in the darkness below.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 19. Hallie struggles to fall asleep. Wrestles with her makesh bed. Looks over at Wren and sees her eyes are open, too. unsettled look on her face. Across the room, Katie looks at her phone. And Chloe just lies there on her cot. Both also far from sleep. Hallie says nothing. Just lies back down and closes her e But we see... POV - The laptop rests on the coffee table. The tiny gree light blinking. Endlessly. Draining the power.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY, A FLURRY OF IMAGES ON THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: We can see now they are split second flashes of Slender M that quickly vanish into nothing. Back to an ordinary laptop. No blinking green light. No m power to be drained. Just a dead black screen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie looks slightly distracted as she sits with Hallie, Wren, and Chloe. But the girls don’t really see it. Hallie finds her gaze continually drawn a few rows over. where Tom sits. She quickly averts her eyes when he looks her direction.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Don't make any pregnancy jokes but I felt so nauseous this morning. I threw up twice. Hallie turns at this, faintly troubled.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Have you been having nightmares? Chloe thinks about it. Shakes her head. But Hallie notice Wren react to the question.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you? Wren looks like she's been caught at something.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What was it?  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 20.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Nothing really, just that video...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: From the sleep over? Wren nods.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But that was like a week ago.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Not really surprising. Hallie contemplates. Meanwhile, Katie continues to stare blankly out her window. Into the treeline.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why a cemetery? It’s hardly worth a field trip. I mean, it’s a goddamn cemetery? Large granite monuments, crumbling headstones form a crud skyline behind the gates of an old cemetery. Inside, a GROUP OF STUDENTS follow a TOUR GUIDE. Wren and girls amongst them.

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: This burial ground dates back to the Revolutionary War... Katie and Hallie follow, lagging behind. Katie ignores th tour and stares off into the distance. POV - A TREELINE skirts the edge of the old cemetery. The trees tower above it. A dense, untamed forest. No way to where one tree begins and another ends. TOUR GUIDE (CONT’D) Generations of soldiers have been laid to rest here since... Now the tour passes A LARGE MAUSOLEUM. Elaborate carvings etched in the cracked and deteriorating stone walls. As the guide continues on, Katie steps away from the grou She drifts across, studying the massive grave.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 21. A LIFE-SIZED BRONZE STATUE OF AN ANGEL guards the entranc the mausoleum. Decades of corrosion have turned the angel skin a ghastly shade of green. Katie steps over and faces the lifeless statue. Years of weathering and erosion give the horrific appeara of BLACK TEARS FLOWING FROM THE ANGEL’S EYES. Mold grows the dark stains that stream down her face. The tour guide’s voice fades into the background as Katie absorbs the angel’s empty gaze. We see a deep sadness in Katie’s eyes. Emotion hiding jus under the surface. It overwhelms her. Tears begin to form And just as her first tear is about to fall... IT TURNS BLACK AND RUNS DOWN HER CHEEK. Then another one... Two dark tears drip from her eyes. Katie wipes them away. BUT THE TEARS KEEP FLOWING. STREAMING DOWN HER FACE. Katie panics when she looks at her hands. Inky black liqu drips off her face and pools in the palms of her hands. Her panic turns to pain and she starts to choke. The blac tears streak down her face, draining the color from her s She looks back up, fighting for air...

dialogues.speaker: FEATURELESS. A BLANK VOID
dialogues.text: KATIE GASPS FOR AIR. SHE CAN’T LOOK AWAY! WE SEE THE TERROR IN KATIE’S EYES AS THE STATUE RISES UP

dialogues.speaker: SLENDER FIGURE. ARMS REACHING DOWNWARD
dialogues.text: KATIE STANDS PARALYZED. SHE CAN’T MOVE. IT HAS CONTROL OV

dialogues.speaker: HER BODY
dialogues.text: SHE CAN’T BREATHE!! SHE CAN’T SCREAM!!!

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Katie! KATIE’S BODY JOLTS AS SHE SNAPS OUT OF THE VISION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Hallie’s face. She stands right in front of Katie.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 22. Everything is back to normal. The angel stands silently outside the mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Katie... Katie looks around, confusion all over her face.

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: (to Katie) You okay, young lady? Looks like you've seen a ghost... Katie shakes her head. TOUR GUIDE (CONT’D) Well, you wouldn’t be the first... As the group continues on, Katie’s eyes are drawn again t the distant treeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus-load of kids sit waiting. Everyone there, except Ka Hallie looks out, scanning the perimeter for her friend. At the gates of the cemetery. A TEACHER talks to the BUS DRIVER. Just out of earshot. We see the urgency in the teacher’s words. The anxiety in her eyes. The bus driver looks past her, searching...

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: It’s Katie we're waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Did she seem weird to you today?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Weird? Wren looks at Hallie.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Weird how? Hallie shrugs, shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Distant. She hardly said anything all day.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 23.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Well, her bag’s here. She wouldn’t just leave without it. She motions to the backpack slung on the seat next to her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students, now pulled off the bus, stand by as MORE TEACHERS and SCHOOL OFFICIALS confer with CEMETERY OFFICI The girls watch as the commotion swirls around them. Hall finds that, by chance, Tom is standing right next to her. He looks in her direction. They catch eyes. Hallie takes it as an invitation.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: If we have to stand around here any longer, I think I’m gonna die. Tom gives a slight chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No pun intended...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (amused) None taken. Tom’s smile slowly fades as they share an awkward pause. Nearby, Wren's on her phone, as Chloe anxiously looks on.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Katie, cut this shit out. We're all prisoners ‘cause of you....

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (to Hallie) None of you saw where she went? Hallie just shakes her head. Wren hangs up and steps over

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: It cut me off! Her mailbox is full.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: She hasn't answered any of my texts, either.  31 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 24. Hallie, Wren, and Tom look up to see Chloe’s eyes widenin They spin around, and as if to confirm their darkest fear A TRIO OF POLICE CARS SWOOP INTO THE PARKING LOT.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!!

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: This is getting serious, people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tired sun dips behind the treeline. Slender shadows r across the graveyard, welcoming nightfall. POLICE talk to school officials, finally releasing kids t their waiting PARENTS. There are FLASHLIGHTS in the woods. A SEARCH PARTY. Chloe watches them moving behind the trees. The lights vanish and reappear as they hunt for any sign her missing friend. Under everything, like a whisper in t wind, we can hear the sound of the workers calling her na “Kaaaaatieee...” Wren judges the look on Chloe’s face.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: She just ditched. Trust me. She’1l still be there annoying us tomorrow. Chloe nods. The sentiment helps, but she’s not convinced. Hallie rummages through Katie's bag nearby. She stops and peeks inside. Reaches in and pulls out... AN OLD LIBRARY BOOK. The cover partially torn. Pages comi unbound. The title instantly strikes her: BARDO THODOL. The worn pages almost break and split, crackling as Halli flips through. Wren leans in to get a better look. A SERIES OF HAUNTING ILLUSTRATIONS FLASH BY... - Dark spirits and tortured souls. - Winged demons with razor sharp teeth.  32 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 25. - Phantoms amid a desolate landscape burning in the sun. - A man screams, flesh being ripped from his body.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What class was this for? Wren and Chloe have no response. In the shadow of the graveyard behind them, the question takes on more weight. Wren just gestures towards the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Hallie... Hallie's parents pull up, her mother waving from the wind

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll keep this shit for her.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (to Chloe and Wren) Do you need a ride?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: My mom’s on her way.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Okay. Call you later... Hallie hands over the book and heads to the car. As she leaves, she glances back over her shoulder. Still no sign of Katie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: News about Katie's disappearance plays on the TV. Hallie watching with her family in the living room. As she live- texts with Wren and Chloe- Wren: This is unreal. Hallie: I know. Chloe: My mom asked if she was doing porn. Hallie: And I thought my parents were dumb. Hallie’s father turns up the TV volume now. She looks up.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 26.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Despite new footage, we're still left with more questions than answers. ON TV: Shaky phone footage of the students at the cemeter Kids have their lunch on the grass. Katie is visible in t background of the shot, unnoticed by the foreground kids. stands very still, frozen, staring off into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: No word at this time about any possible mental health issues she might have had or...

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Was she on drugs? Hallie shoots her sister a look.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (quietly) You're not helping.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Was she?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: No. Don’t be ridiculous. Hallie’s family thinks she has answers to the mystery. Bu she doesn’t...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OMINOUS POV - As if something is watching the school from woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS listen as a TEACHER drones on in the background. Hallie stares out the window. Searching. Trying to compre the grim fact that Katie is still missing. Then Hallie’s expression darkens. Something unsettling... HALLIE’S POV - Two police cars pull up in front of the school. THE OFFICERS hop out. There’s a short exchange an they head into the building.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 27. A murmur rolls through the classroom as other students ta notice.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hallie. Hallie snaps out of it and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They need you in the principal’s office... As Hallie gathers her things, the whispers evolve into a of conversation. Theories about Katie’s disappearance fil the air and follow her out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: When did you last see her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blank, white walls give it the feel of an interrogati room. Hallie sits opposite a stern-faced PRINCIPAL and TW POLICE OFFICERS. Confused and nervous, she chooses her wo carefully.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: At the cemetery...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: And before that?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: It was Saturday. We spent the night at Katie’s house...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: We?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Me, Chloe and Hallie...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: We slept in the basement.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Mr. Jensen was upstairs. Passed out on the couch. Again...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Where was her mother?  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 28.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: She moved out a while back.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Did Katie have a boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Have you seen the boys at this school?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Maybe there was someone she didn’t tell you about?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: No. She’s my best friend. Since Kindergarten...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Would you say she was a happy girl?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: She used to be...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: But then her mom ran off with that yoga instructor.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Did she ever talk about running away?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: But we all did...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: I mean seriously, who hasn't memorized the bus schedule outta this shithole... Tears form in Hallie’s eyes as her voice falters.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: She wouldn’t just leave...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: It happens more often than you’d imagine. The officers wrap things up.  34 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 29.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Is there anything else? Chloe hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Anything you haven’t told us?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A locker slams open. Hallie quickly swaps books and folde Then she pauses, looking into the locker. A collage of pictures and clippings held in place by magn and tape. Stickered symbols and logos of her favorite ban And crowded in the center -- A PHOTO OF HALLIE AND KATIE TAKEN YEARS AGO. A silly middle-school moment. Sparkling smiles. A flash o innocence. Before they started taking themselves seriousl Before Katie went missing... A deep sadness fills Hallie’s eyes as she shuts her locke

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! She turns around to see Wren and Chloe hustling over.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What’d they ask you?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: They wanted to know about Mr. Jensen. And his drinking...

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: They asked me if I saw anything weird. On the field trip...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What’d you tell’em?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: No. But--— Chloe stops and looks around to see if anyone’s listening  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 30.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was looking on my phone. The stuff I took at the cemetery... She holds it out and taps the screen. Hallie squints to see.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's almost at the end... - SHAKY FOOTAGE: Kyle sheepishly turns away as Chloe gigg from behind the camera. CHLOE (0.S.) (CONT’D) C’mon...do it... - The camera circles around, chasing. But Kyle tucks his down, keeping his back to us. CHLOE (0.S.) (CONT’D) Just one more time, for me... - She corners him and Kyle gives in.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Okay, okay! - He faces the camera and flashes a completely nauseating but adorable puppy dog, sad face. Then he ducks out of fr - The camera lingers for a split second, trailing over th trees in the background... Horror spreads across Wren’s face.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Barf...I think I’m gonna throw up.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Shut up, not that. Chloe hits pause.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to be seeing? Chloe takes a SCREENSHOT. Double-taps to ZOOM IN... We fix on a blur of unfocused confusion. Chloe adjusts th image until something slowly comes into view...  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 31. A_SHADOWED FIGURE.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: It could be anything.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: It’s a man, Moron. The words send a chill down their spines. The three girls just stare at the phone. THE HAUNTING IMAGE STARES BACK. Hallie’s nervous laugh breaks the spell.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Come on...It IS a public place...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Hallie! It's a goddamn man, standing next to a goddamn cemetery in the woods, watching goddamn teenagers. That’s pretty GODDAMN creepy right there, don’t you think? Terrible possibilities flood the girls' minds. Hallie han the phone back to Chloe.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Did you show it to the police? It might be evidence. Probably not. But you should give it to them. Just to be... You know...

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Yeah. I know, but...It’s probably nothing. Hallie nods. She and Wren start to move on but only get a steps before Chloe calls after them-

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wasn’t thinking it was Slender Man. I mean, if that’s what you thought I was thinking. Hallie turns back.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: No, I know.  35 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 32. But Hallie looks uneasy. Wren does, too. Though in a different way. A hint of excitement dances in her eyes. EXT. HALLIE’S HOUSE -- LATER THAT NIGHT 35 OMINOUS POV - A two-story home sits in darkness. The porc light casts long thin shadows into the yard. As the POV inches closer, a figure inside the house appea in the front window. The POV watches the figure hold for moment and move past the window. Then the OMINOUS POV continues onto the porch and up to the front door. INT. HALLIE’S HOUSE -- CONTINUOUS Muffled voices echo off the walls as the MOVING POV moves silently down an empty hallway. A shaft of light spills through an open door to another room. The voices grow louder as the OMINOUS POV slips through t light and into shadow. The words gradually become clear..

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I could stay home alone you know. I'm old enough.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Physical age, maybe. The mysterious POV turns a corner, plunging into darkness past an even darker utility room. Moving ever so slowly, it drifts closer and closer to a brightly lit...

dialogues.speaker: DEN
dialogues.text: Lizzie sits on the floor, homework scattered in front of Hallie is huddled up on the couch looking at her phone. - ON THE SCREEN: The shaky video of Kyle from Chloe’s cam

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: C’mon...do it... - The camera spins around Kyle. Hallie taps the screen and fast-forwards. - In fast motion, the camera circles around. Hallie taps play.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 33. CHLOE (0.S.) (CONT’D) Just one more time, for me... Lizzie peeks over, trying to see.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: You should tell me what really happened to Katie. We never keep secrets from each other. PAUSE. Hallie hides the screen.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: How would you know? Do your homework.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: It was a boy, right? You think I'll tell. I’d never tell.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (a little smile) You'd totally tell.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: Not mom and dad.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Totally mom and dad.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Definitely. But you get points for honesty.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: So tell me! Hallie just gives an empty look.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don't know...do you? Lizzie watches her search for an answer, but there isn’t

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Lizzie, just finish your homework. With a sigh, Lizzie turns to the papers scattered around Hallie shifts back to the phone. The video. She taps play - ON THE SCREEN: Chloe laughs as the camera follows Kyle.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 34.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Okay, okay! - He makes his goofy sad face and ducks out of frame. PAUSE. Hallie taps the screen. - Slowly...frame by frame by frame...we inch through the video. Then stop...ON THAT FRAME. - The one we’ve seen before on Chloe’s phone. The one of man watching them from the woods. Hallie studies the frozen image closely. HALLIE’S POV - A LONG SHADOWED FIGURE. - The compressed pixels don’t provide enough detail. Just vague outline sketched in a chaotic array of digital bits The bits add up to something that resembles a strange, ta thin human-like form. CRACK. A sound from somewhere inside the house. Both girls turn towards the sound, listening. It’s almost if it didn’t happen. But it did.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Did you hear that? Lizzie just nods, a troubled look in her eyes. We listen with our ears wide open. It’s so quiet we can h everything. The girls breathing. A clock on the wall tick Hallie stares out of the open door, into the hallway. But there’s nothing. Only shadow. No sound. No movement. silence, until... ANOTHER NOISE. This time quieter. Softer.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: What is that-

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Shh! Hallie steps over to the open doorway and pauses. Listeni

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mom?  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 35. Her voice shatters the silence. They wait, listening. But there’s no response.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad? The words echo out into the hallway and disappear. THEN SOMETHING DRAGS!! Like furniture being moved... The girls freeze.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: Someone’s here... Hallie motions for her to be quiet and moves into the hallway. Towards the dark void inside the utility room. Listens a moment. Still nothing. Her eyes darting from place to place in the hallway. Searching every corner. Checking every shadow. HALLIE’S CELLPHONE CHIMES. The sound sends a jolt through her body. She checks the screen... - It's that screenshot from Chloe’s phone. The man in the trees watching them. But clearer now. - The accompanying text, from Wren: “Auto-corrected for brightness on Chloe's computer!” She focuses her eyes back toward the utility room. A blac hole of darkness inside. She holds still as her eyes adju HALLIE’S POV OF THE UTILITY ROOM - Just a washing machine Cleaning products. An ironing board. Hallie continues past, slowly peeking around the corner. HALLIE’S POV - The corridor leads away from us, into the front of house. Still empty. Only the one slash of light cutting across hallway.

dialogues.speaker: NOW A FLOOR BOARD CREAKS IN THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Hallie can’t see it, but something is moving in the front the house.

dialogues.speaker: CREAK
dialogues.text: 37 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 36. It continues as something heavy moves through the open sp in the house. Rocking back and forth...Changing pitch. Louder. Softer. Hallie stares down the hallway as a shadow comes into vie HALLIE’S POV - A long, thin, distorted human-like shape stretches across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDING INTO THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Hallie scrambles back into the den, glancing back. A LIGHT FLICKERS ON IN THE HALLWAY. A light that wasn't there just a moment ago! Beaming down into the utility room. Hallie slides into the den. Lizzie holds tight to her sis staring out. Trapped in the room. Then slowly, like spilled ink...

dialogues.speaker: WALL. AT ANY MOMENT IT WILL ROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: INT. HALLIE’S HOUSE - DEN -- CONTINUOUS 37 Lizzie starts to say something, but Hallie wraps her hand over her mouth and shuts the door as quietly as possible.

dialogues.speaker: THEY HEAR THE FLOOR CREAK OUTSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: The sound grows louder and louder. Closer and closer... Accompanied by a LOW MURMUR! Lizzie is consumed with fear, starts to cry...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Shh! THEY HEAR THAT LOW MURMUR AGAIN. The sisters stand there, holding their breath. Listening. Waiting...

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY, THE DEN DOOR KNOB JIGGLES
dialogues.text: Something on the other side! Trying to get in!  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 37. Lizzie clutches Hallie’s arm, hiding behind her.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (threatens ) We called the police! She only now begins to dial 9...1... But the jiggling stops. And then nothing. Just a dead, heavy silence. Hallie lets out a trembling breath. Eyes fixed on the doo Lizzie hides behind her, fear building as each moment pas THEN POUNDING on the other side of the door...

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRLS JUMP AND SCREAM
dialogues.text: But the pounding only lasts a second. Followed by a LOW, MUFFLED SOUND... Like a hopeless sob. Hallie's expression changes. She keeps Lizzie behind her steps over to the door. She slowly opens it. Just a crack Then freezes. She sees something... HALLIE’S POV - A TALL, MASSIVE FIGURE silhouetted by the light in the hallway! Its back to her...

dialogues.speaker: DEEP VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is she here? Hallie starts to back away when- The figure turns around. IT’S KATIE’S FATHER! His clothes unwashed and stained. Haggard and unshaven. A madness behind his bloodshot eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Mr. Jensen? KATIE’S FATHER Is she?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Jesus. You scared me. What are you doing-  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 38. KATIE’S FATHER Answer me, Goddamnit! Is she? Hallie's about to answer. But Katie's Father turns venomo

dialogues.speaker: KATIE'S FATHER
dialogues.text: Is my daughter here? Are you hiding her here!? He moves towards her. KATIE’S FATHER Tell me! Hallie backs up. Scared-

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know!

dialogues.speaker: KATIE'S FATHER
dialogues.text: It's 'cause of you! She was never into any of that stuff before. All that occult stuff! Lizzie sticks her head out from behind Hallie.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Lizzie! Stay back! But Katie's Father charges in. His watery-red eyes glarin

dialogues.speaker: KATIE'S FATHER
dialogues.text: Where is she?! Where's my daughter?! He reaches for Hallie, his giant hands clamping down on h arms.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Let go!!! Hallie tries to wrestle free.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE'S FATHER
dialogues.text: Give me back my daughter! They stumble into the middle of the room. Katie’s father loses his balance. Staggers into the coffee table. Hallie breaks loose. Scrambles to Lizzie. They bolt out o the room, running down the hallway towards the front door  39 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue and red lights reflect on the walls. Hallie watches her window as Katie's Father is gently placed in a POLICE CAR. Another text from Wren: No comment? U can clearly see him Outside, Hallie's Father is yelling at Katie's Father thr the police car window. Hallie's Mother is trying to restr her husband. Hallie starts to type: Katie's Father was here... But Hallie stops typing. She looks at Katie's Father distraught and crumpled over in the back seat of the crui She deletes her typing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie passes out flyers asking for leads on Katie’s disappearance. She comes upon Wren and Chloe with A BUNCH OF OTHER KIDS. Hallie’s expression changes to nervous when she realizes is there. She avoids making eye contact. Tom is looking at Chloe’s phone.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (to Chloe) You didn't see anything at the park? When you were taking the video?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Just trees. The police said it’s the light. Playing tricks.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Probably. It doesn’t really look like anything... Tom notices Hallie and smiles. Hallie smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Looks like something to me... Naturally, Wren directs the conversation back to herself-  4l Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 40.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean... There are just things that can’t be explained.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You guys really summoned Slender Man?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Well, sort of... I guess. (self-consciously) Why?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: We chickened out--

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (teases Kyle) YOU chickened out! The group laughs. Starts to break up. Hallie decides she can’t keep it a secret any longer. Blurts out-

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Katie’s Father broke into my house last night. Everyone turns at that news. WHAT?!

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He said some crazy shit about Katie being into the occult. Then, he blamed us for getting her into it. Tom's intrigued. Wren and Chloe look stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie walks away. Wren and Chloe stalk after her.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell us about Katie's Father?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I just did.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: What did he mean about Katie being “into the occult"?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Not sure. He was pretty wasted.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) Al.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (excited) Christ! She had that book in her bag! About phantoms and stuff... (beat) This could be the next wrinkle in the story...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I don't want to play this game.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: If this is all a game, then where's Katie? That stops Hallie in her tracks.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We know things nobody else knows.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What do we know?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: We know that Katie was apparently taking this paranormal shit very seriously just before she disappeared. We know she watched that video.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with anything?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Maybe Slender Man came for her... Hallie scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Or, maybe she couldn’t take Sergeant Drunk Dad anymore and ran away--

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: And not say goodbye? To any of us? A silent, but heavy beat. They all contemplate this for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When we watched that video, it did something to all of us. I felt it.  42 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 42.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I didn't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I didn't see anything either, Wren.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: I didn’t say I saw it... I felt it. I think you did, too. I'm damn sure Katie felt it. And that's why she disappeared. Hallie makes a sound like a snort. Wren imitates it back.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's your comeback? We have to take this shit seriously! We have a responsibility here... Hallie looks conflicted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OMINOUS POV - As if something was watching through a twis thicket of trees. Hallie, Wren and Chloe stand under a st lamp. A dim pool of light cutting through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: This is a bad idea. The girls stare across the street to Katie's house. The flicker of a TV glows in the front windows like death pale eyes watching over a lawn that has gone to hell.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: He’1ll be passed out by now.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Just a quick look around. There’s gotta be something. A clue maybe-

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? You didn’t see how he was last night.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What’s the alternative? Do nothing...  43 44 45 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 43.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: The back door’s always open. (they look at her) I’m just saying... Wren starts across the street. Chloe’s right behind her. Hallie pauses, her feet stuck to the curb. She watches as the girls slip into darkness on the other the street. Then checks the block. Neighboring houses sit in darkness, crickets chirping ove the silence. THAT OMINOUS POV AGAIN - From behind the twisted branches Hallie steps quickly across the street, following the oth two before she changes her mind. The POV follows. Stalkin her from the trees. EXT. KATIE’S HOUSE -- NIGHT 43 Wren moves quietly to one of the front windows. Chloe rig behind, step for step. A moment later, Hallie appears. She looks over their shoulders, anxiety dancing in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (glances back) Told you... INT. KATIE’S LIVING ROOM -- NIGHT 44 We see them peek in from the darkness outside the window. Mr. Jensen is slouched on the couch. A sickly wash of lig blankets him from the television. His head rests to the s clutching a half empty bottle of cheap vodka. EXT. KATIE’S HOUSE -- NIGHT 45 Wren glances back at the other two with a slight grin. Chloe and Hallie see it in her eyes. “We’re doing this."  46 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 44,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorknob turns on the back door. A slow CREAK as it opens. Wren pokes her head in. The house is silent except the low drone from the TV. Underneath it, we can hear Mr. Jensen snoring. Wren carefully steps inside. Hallie and Chloe slip in beh They move quietly into a dark hallway stretching out in f of them. As they pass the kitchen we see an OPEN PANTRY D In the shadows, we can just make out a cluttered table an chairs. The filthy sink is piled high with dishes. Wren looks back at them with a “Can-you-believe-how-cool- is?” smile. She pauses near an entryway table. A framed picture of Katie with her dad sits on top. Happier times. They peek into the living room. POV - Mr. Jensen lies on the couch, still snoring softly. Wren turns to Hallie and Chloe, gives them the hush sign continues. As she turns, Wren bumps the entryway table, knocking over the framed picture.

dialogues.speaker: CLAP
dialogues.text: IN THE SILENCE, IT’S LIKE A GUN SHOT. MR. JENSEN IS STARTLED AWAKE.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JENSEN
dialogues.text: Katie? The girls stand in silence, listening. Then as they slowl start to back away... A FLOORBOARD CREAKS UNDER THEIR FEET. Confused, Mr. Jensen turns toward the sound...

dialogues.speaker: PULLS HIMSELF TO HIS FEET.
dialogues.text: He reaches for the SIDE TABLE DRAWER. Slides it open to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: A GUN
dialogues.text: He grabs it. And revolver poised, cautiously heads in the direction of the noise he heard.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 45. The girls recoil and track back down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JENSEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who’s there? The girls duck into the kitchen. One hiding place. The open pantry. They all try to pile in, but it’s too small. The girls ar in a frantic whisper. We hear Mr. Jensen’s heavy boots clunk on the hollow wood floor in the front of the house. Wren leaves them and backtracks into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JENSEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (voice booming) Who’s there? Wren glances back. She sees Mr. Jensen’s shadow stretch out from the living onto the floor in the hallway. His footsteps approaching. Ten feet seem like a hundred as Wren turns to the back do Mr. Jensen, gun in hand, rounds the corner to the hallway WHERE WREN WAS JUST A SPLIT SECOND BEFORE. It’s empty. She’s gone. INSIDE THE PANTRY: Chloe and Hallie hear heavy measured footsteps moving closer. They hear Mr. Jensen step into t kitchen and stop just outside the pantry door. The girls hear the man’s heavy breaths. They're frozen. Trapped. The girls peer through the downw slats of the door as Mr. Jensen makes his way in. Oh shit...THEY SEE HIS GUN!!! Mr. Jensen scans the darkness in the kitchen. It’s diffic to make out much detail, but he can see it’s empty. INSIDE THE PANTRY: Chloe and Hallie hold perfectly still. breathing. Eyes wide. On that gun. Scared to death... MR. JENSEN FOCUSES ON THE PANTRY DOOR. Slowly...  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 46. INSIDE THE PANTRY: The girls see him raise the gun, as he steps towards them. They back up as far as they can from door. Now only his boots are visible. THE BOOTS STOP JUST OUTSIDE THE DOOR...

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORBELL.
dialogues.text: Mr. Jensen shudders, spinning in the direction of the fro door. But his attention is quickly back on the possible intruders. The sound that woke him. What he thought he heard. Then..

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORBELL RINGS AGAIN
dialogues.text: A long beat. Mr. Jensen slowly pulls the gun up and retre Heading to the door. INSIDE THE PANTRY: Hallie and Chloe listen as the footste pound away from them. They finally exhale. Mr. Jensen looks through the front window. He sees who it and tucks the gun behind his back. He steps over and opens the door to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: MR. JENSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wren?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Jensen. She glances briefly over Mr. Jensen’s shoulder. In the background, Hallie and Chloe quickly leave the pantry. He in the opposite direction. Hallie goes straight for the back door. But Chloe pulls h towards Katie’s room.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JENSEN
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: I just wanted to see if there’s something I can do. If I can help in any way... Again, her eyes drift over his shoulder. OFF WREN’S LOOK, Mr. Jensen glances back just as the girl disappear into Katie’s room. All he sees is an empty hall  47 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 47. He turns back to Wren.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JENSEN
dialogues.text: How? He stares at her with bloodshot eyes, the emotion buildin just under the surface.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JENSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hopeless) What can you do?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: I was hoping you'd tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both girls enter and just stand there for a moment. Feeli the weight of this violation. There is nothing feminine about the bare-bones room. No frills. A mess of clothes and junk. Blank walls. A simple sits opposite a little desk.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (whispers) She's really gone.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I know. Hallie crosses to Katie's desk where a tangle of cables l like severed limbs.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The police must've taken her desktop. Hallie looks more closely. She eyes A FEW BOOKS that surr an empty spot where the computer was. ON THE COVER OF ONE OF THE BOOKS: A repulsive scaly creat curls around itself. Horns and a tail. One clawed hand hi its entire face. Hallie’s gaze shifts to a crude sketch on a scrap of pape CLOSE ON: A strange, abstract drawing. - A chaotic mess of penciled strokes depict a tall, thin human-like figure. Its elongated arms hang slack at its sides. A smaller figure is roughed out next to it. An arm from each figure overlap. Like they’re connected...  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 48. - LIKE A TALL, THIN MONSTER HOLDING A CHILD’S HAND... THE MURMUR OF VOICES IN THE NEXT ROOM GROWS LOUDER. Heavy footsteps in the hallway head towards us. Hallie and Chloe focus on the closed bedroom door. Frozen

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Shit! There’s definitely no way out. The murmurs evolve into muffled words as they get closer.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JENSEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: .+.-you can see what they did. They took her stuff-- A bead of sweat rolls down Hallie’s forehead.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (quickly) Mr. Jensen. Could I have a glass of water? Chloe and Hallie listen as the footsteps pause. They back away, retreating down the hallway. Their muffle words dissolve back into a garbled murmur. The two girls exhale, quickly returning to their search. Hallie opens Katie's closet. A confusion of clothes and shoes cover the floor. A few things still dangle from their hangers. Hallie shoves them aside, checking the wall inside.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: She kept cigarettes and stuff in here... She pulls a section of paneling away from the wall. KATIE’S LAPTOP. She lifts it out as Chloe comes over. Wide-eyed-

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Let’s just take it.  48 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 49. Hallie looks surprised. Chloe's surprised herself. She mo to the bedroom door and carefully opens it. As the girls step out, they see Wren and Mr. Jensen's sha stretching out into the hallway. And hear Katie’s Father quietly sobbing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie, Wren and Chloe are gathered around Katie's laptop

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Katie was using Tor? I didn't think she was techie enough for that. It's pretty basic, but still. This is like deep-web, dark-net-type shit.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Isn't that like...where people buy drugs and guns online?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Among other things... Wren clicks on the web history in the browser. - A massive list populates. All strange headings. Devil worship, evil spirits, black magic, witchcraft.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here’s the last site she visited. - The untitled link is a string numbers separated by peri There is no “www.” or “.com”. She clicks it and a website appears. - No header. No splash page. Just a dark black background the center, a simple text box with A BLINKING CURSOR.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: It looks like you need a password.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Cydonia66. She uses it for everything.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: She still likes Muse? Hallie shrugs.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 50. Wren tries the password. - The text box disappears and THREE RED CIRCLES materiali in its place...

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Now what? - Just as quickly, the circles dissolve into FIVE TRIANGL

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this a game? - The triangles fade as EIGHT SQUARES appear. The sequenc ends with small empty box. - A CURSOR FLASHES.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: It’s a puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Circle, triangle, square...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Octagon? Trapezoid? Hallie gives a little smirk.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: No, it’s a number. Hallie reaches in and presses enter. - The cycle repeats. Three circles. Five triangles. Eight Squares... - The cursor just sits there. Blinking. Taunting them.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thirteen! Wren and Chloe look at her, confused.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: THREE plus FIVE is Eight. FIVE plus EIGHT is THIRTEEN She types in the UNLUCKY NUMBER. - Now a new screen loads.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were a math geek.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 51.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I'm not... Not really. (like a confession) I just do well in a test environment. - A series of odd names and dates scroll onto the page. B red-colored text, underlined on a black background.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What am I looking at?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Alton is in Illinois. These are all town names and dates. Click one... Wren clicks on one of the links. - A VIDEO OPENS: We see the ground. Weeds and dirt. Grain and low res. The camera shakes, flashing across the sky a back again. When it steadies, we see children playing on playground. - But the moment we hear laughter and excitement, the vid pauses. Goes silent. The children frozen in time. - AND IN THE BACKGROUND, out of focus, there’s an indisti human shape. Tall and thin with an unsettling posture. It head slumped to one side. Long arms hanging down at its sides... -— THEN THE IMAGE DISTORTS. A HIGH PITCHED SHRILL explodes from the speakers. All thr flinch as the image cuts out.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit!

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Click on a different one. Wren does. - A STILL IMAGE: A canted angle in the forest at night. A hurried composition. The nearby foliage is bleached from camera’s flash. The light quickly falls off into a darken path between trees.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: It’s him...  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 52. Silence fill the room as the girls lean in closer. - At the end of a path, a man. His strange narrow frame sketched in moonlight filtering down from above. Barely visible, but definitely there. Arms the length of his bod extend towards us.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I don’t like this. Wren closes the haunting image.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Look! She point to a chat box at the bottom of the page. Wren scrolls through the feed.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: AlleyKat93? Jeeze. They went back and forth like a hundred times... Wren expands the feed.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (reading) "I knew he was there before I saw him. Did he have hands for you?" What? Did he have hands for you?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (excited) It's like they're comparing experiences. All these places and dates. I wonder if they're all Slender Man sightings.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Wait. Look... Katie posted a video. Wren clicks on the link. - A VIDEO OPENS: Katie stands in the woods. She holds up phone like she’s taking a selfie, but not smiling. She wa Slowly through the trees. The forest whirls around her as makes her way. Her eyes empty, void of emotion. ON THE GIRLS - Transfixed on the secret video of their friend. And then their faces change. Eyes widening as a w of dread washes over them. The video ends and they look at each other-  49 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 53.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What did you see?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What did you see?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I don't know either... Maybe nothing? We hear the denial in their words. Nobody wants to say it loud, but it’s clear. They all saw something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lamp on the bedside table warms the room. Hallie lies b looks at her phone. The blue glow lights her face. - ON THE PHONE: Three circles turn to triangles, then squares. Hallie types “13”. A wrinkle of concern appears on her brow as she waits for page to load. We watch her scroll down the sparse web pag With a couple of taps, Katie’s video appears. Hallie presses play... - ON SCREEN: Katie’s face, staring into camera. The fores swirls around her as she winds her way through the trees. Hallie watches closer now. Waiting. And then a look of recognition in her eyes. Now we see what they saw before. Behind Katie...

dialogues.speaker: DEFINITELY THERE.
dialogues.text: - Katie stops walking. She clearly knows he's behind her. Eyes wide with fear. But she doesn't take them off the iP in her hand. Not even as the figure slowly starts to come closer...and closer... Hallie helplessly watches what unfolds before her eyes.  50 51 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 54, - The towering figure approaches Katie from behind. He mo through the underbrush, almost floating. The branches scraping and snapping around his body. The long arms hang down horribly at his sides as he moves effortlessly. - As he comes closer and closer, we just start to make ou what should be his face. Instead, just a lifeless empty v

dialogues.speaker: WHISPERED VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hallie... Hallie looks up from her phone. Listening. She stands and crosses over to the door. Opens it. Peers HALLIE’S POV - The dark hallway sits in silence outside h room. But, just as she goes to close her door, she hears the vo again. Like a distant call.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hallie... It’s a voice we recognize.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Katie? Slowly, she steps into the hallway. INT. HALLIE’S HOUSE - HALLWAY -- CONTINUOUS 50 Hallie steps softly down the empty hall. The house around is so quiet we can hear her feet pad lightly on the floor She heads towards the back of the house, but as she approaches the end of the hall we hear tiny sounds outsid Hallie peeks around the corner. THE BACK DOOR IS WIDE OPEN. The sounds of night filter in. Crickets chirping.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hallie... Katie’s voice floats in on a gentle breeze from outside. EXT. HALLIE’S HOUSE -- NIGHT 51 Hallie steps out searching the darkness in the backyard.  52 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 55.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (louder) Hallie. Hallie’s looks to the trees beyond and quickens her pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlight fights through the canopy above. A heavy mist r through the trees in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Katie? Is that you? Her voice just carries into the woods and disappears. She continues into the darkness. The forest becoming more more dense. She slips under branches that block her way, steps over a fallen tree. Its trunk is stained a sulphuro yellow by disease. And just as her foot touches the forest floor... A LOUD WHISPER IN HALLIE’S EAR!

dialogues.speaker: KATIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hallie... Hallie spins around. A chill running down her spine as sh searches the blackness all around her.

dialogues.speaker: WE SEE KATIE PASS IN THE DISTANCE
dialogues.text: But only for a moment. Then she disappears into the fog drifting between trees. Hallie follows, moving deeper into the woods. She steps quickly, twigs snapping under her feet.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Katie! She's running now towards the tree where Katie slipped aw Hallie reaches it and looks around. Nothing. Only empty forest.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Katie! Come back... WE HEAR WHISPERED VOICES ECHOING IN THE DISTANCE.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 56.

dialogues.speaker: VOICES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hallie...Hallie... Hallie searches, but can’t locate them. She is surrounded an endless forest that leads into darkness. CRACK! A branch breaks nearby. Hallie spins towards the sound. HALLIE’S POV - A fogged path through the trees. CRACK!! Another broken branch echoes in the distance. Hallie stands frozen. Staring. HALLIE’S POV - We see movement behind the fog. Between th trees. Slowly growing. Closer and closer until...

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: Tree branches thrash against each other in the dark haze. Hallie stumbles, backpedaling. Suddenly, something is visible through the fog. A thin sh moving through the tree branches.

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING IS WALKING TOWARDS US
dialogues.text: Hallie turns to run, her feet pounding back towards the house. She glances back... HALLIE’S POV - Something tall and thin moves through the

dialogues.speaker: HER
