dialogues.text: We see panic spark in her eyes as she quickens her pace. TWIGS AND BRANCHES SNAP BEHIND HER. LOUDER AND LOUDER... Hallie glances back, now in a dead run.... HALLIE’S POV - The tall, thin shape closes in. It’s still hidden in the haze, but we can almost make it out. It’s a towering human-like figure. Hallie tries to run faster. But the harder she runs, the ground she seems to cover. A savage wail escapes her thro as she scrambles forward. But it’s no use. Her feet pound the forest floor. But each step forward somehow pulls her deeper into the forest. Almost sliding.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 57.

dialogues.speaker: AS IF AN INVISIBLE FORCE IS PULLING HER BACKWARDS
dialogues.text: In desperation, she dives forward and slams to the ground She claws into the earth, trying to hold her ground. Tryi to crawl away. Then, suddenly... A WAVE OF SILENCE. All we hear are Hallie’s panicked, painful breaths. She looks back and scans the forest.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP VOICE
dialogues.text: (distorted) Hallie... HALLIE RECOILS, SPINNING AROUND. THEN HORROR IN HER EYES WHEN SHE SEES... LONG THIN ARMS REACH DOWN FROM ABOVE.

dialogues.speaker: TWO PALE HANDS GRAB HER
dialogues.text: INT. HALLIE’S BEDROOM -- NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: A BONE CHILLING SCREAM
dialogues.text: HALLIE’S BODY JOLTS AWAKE!!

dialogues.speaker: HER. HER EYES DARTING AROUND THE ROOM, SEARCHING...
dialogues.text: Her cell phone falls from her hand and tumbles onto the f just as the door to the bedroom slams open. HALLIE’S FATHER What is it?! Hallie’s parents burst into the room. Her Father quickly scans the space. HALLIE’S MOTHER Hallie, what’s the matter? Hallie still can’t speak or catch her breath. Her Mother scrambles over to the bed. HALLIE’S MOTHER (CONT’D) Hallie! HALLIE’S FATHER There’s nobody here, Hal...  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 58. Hallie snaps out of it, like the end of a trance. She loo around the room as if her parents had come out of nowhere Lizzie appears in the doorway behind them, a worried look her face.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: What’s going on? Hallie’s breathing slowly returns as her family looks on. heart stops pounding. The fear fades from her eyes as she calms and finally takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Just a nightmare. HALLIE’S MOTHER Jeeze, I guess so. HALLIE’S FATHER Scared the hell out of me...

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: Weirdo. Lizzie just does an about-face and disappears into the ha Hallie’s mother offers a hug. HALLIE’S MOTHER Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry. HALLIE’S FATHER It’s okay, Kiddo. Hallie gives an uneasy smile and watches as her parents m their way out of the room. The house grows quiet again as a blanket of silence sets around her. Hallie looks down at her phone on the floor. - That same video of Katie still plays. She just stares i the camera with dead eyes. Winding her way through the tr Waiting for him... Hallie quickly grabs it and taps the screen. The video disappears and the screen goes dark.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wren sits in her room staring at something opposite her b There’s a nervousness in her eyes. She focuses as the ner turn to determination. Across the room sitting on her desk, is Katie’s laptop. T little green power light blinking. Calling to her. Wren jumps from her bed. Wakes the computer. And types quickly. Before she loses the courage. - ON SCREEN: The small empty box on a black background waiting for the UNLUCKY NUMBER. She types it in. 13. - The list of names and dates load onto the page. The sam basic text, red and underlined. Wren pauses. - We scroll through and click on a link. The same link fr before. The one Katie posted. ON SCREEN: The video loads. That huge close-up of Katie's face. Eyes wide. Wren watches, listening to the leaves crunch under Katie’ feet as she meanders through the woods. We know what comes next...

dialogues.speaker: DING
dialogues.text: - An IM pops up in the chat box below. Simple like a programers prompt. The name AlleyKat93 next to it... Wren hits PAUSE. Reads... - Letters appear in succession. Forming two words... - “What’s up?” - The prompt drops down waiting. The cursor blinking. Wren studies it for a moment. - She quickly types: This is a friend of Katie’s. The cur blinks. A slow rhythm on and off. - AlleyKat93 responds: Then you’re a friend of mine. A little smile. Wren takes that as encouragement.  53 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 60. - Types: She’s missing. - AlleyKat93: Of course she is. - Wren: What did you tell her? - AlleyKat93, immediately: What she wanted to know... Wren holds off, considering the cryptic message. - Wren: Which was? - AlleyKat93: The same thing you want to know. Wren's mouth drops open a bit, as if she’s going to say something...

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: I talked to her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fueled by caffeine and nerves, Wren tries to download Hal and Chloe as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: "AlleyKat93." The girl Katie was talking to on that site. I went on there and sent her a message and she answered me!

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You went back on that website?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter. Once you see him, you can't unsee him...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Slender Man! She told me everything. He gets in your head. Like a virus.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: What kind of virus?  Wren sees effort- Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 61.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (emphatic) Like a virus on your computer. That infects your hard drive. Only it’s your brain!

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Wren, slow down...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: She said once the virus takes hold, he’s got you! Some he haunts. Some he drives mad. Others he takes. Like...

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Like Katie. a dubious look on Hallie’s face. Redoubles her

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know it sounds crazy, but AlleyKat says we can UNVEIL OURSELVES. If we surrender something to him. Something that reveals our true selves...

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: What the does hell does that mean? Wren pauses for dramatic effect. The girls sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: We can contact Slender Man. study Wren as the weight of what she’s proposing

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Why the hell would we do that?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: To get Katie back. Hello? She says that like it's the clincher.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (still dubious) Ask Slender Man?  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 62.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: AlleyKat said Katie did it and the next day she was gone.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Katie asked Slender Man to take her?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: She was always talking about running away... The girls digest.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, even if the odds are a million to one any of this is real... That Slender Man has anything to do with Katie’s disappearance. We owe it to her to try. Hallie and Chloe consider this.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: (dawns on her) But what if it is real?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Then we have to do this because we all got into this shit together. I mean Katie is our best friend. And we're the only ones who might be able to help her...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: This is insane.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Maybe... Who’s in? Wren says it like that's the final selling point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie looks at the many TRACK AWARDS on her dresser.  55 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 63.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It has to be a true sacrifice. AlleyKat said it can’t just be anything. It has to be important to you. Something you love... Hallie steps over to her dresser, but instead opens the t drawer. She lifts out an old tattered white scarf. Red words are embroidered at one of the frayed ends... “From the same garden, different flowers bloom.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wren walks along a quiet street. A lone street lamp over powers the moonlight. She follows the treeline, Hallie an Chloe a couple of steps behind. Their shadows stretch out before them as they plot a cour through the scrub brush. We watch as they make their way of the light and into the trees. We see a flashlight click on and watch as they disappear the darkness beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree limbs and branches crack and break the silence as th girls fight their way into the forest. Leaves crunch unde their feet. Each of their steps drum to a different, but steady beat. Wren’s torch forages the path ahead, rolling over fallen decomposing trees. Hallie and Chloe follow close behind. In the distance, we can make out a hint of light. A clear in the forest that allows moonlight to filter down. The girls emerge from a thicket of undergrowth, the flashlight searching the open area. Wren spotlights a massive stump of a tree that decomposed long ago. Bark falling down the sides. Rotten and jagged.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: This should work. The girls approach the makeshift altar. The light in Wren hand is the only relief from the darkness surrounding the  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 64. A dampened silence closes in as the girls form a circle around the tree stump. Wren reaches into her bag and pull out a CERAMIC MONSTROSITY.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I made this in pottery class when I was five. It was supposed to be a coffee mug for my mother. She used it as an ashtray once. But I still always loved it, so it'll count. Wren sets it on the ground and grabs a rock. She smashes misshapen mug and gathers the pieces. She dumps the debri into a decayed opening in the center of the stump. She lo to Chloe to go next. Chloe holds up A PHOTO: A picture of man and a little gir

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: This is the only picture I have of me with my dad. There are other photos of him floating around online. Trips he took with his new girlfriend, things like that. This is the only one where we're together. She tears the photo into tiny pieces and scatters them ov the broken ceramic shards in the damp, rotten hole. Hallie realizes it's her turn. She shows everyone the whi scarf. We see the embroidered description above the ragge and frayed end. “From the same garden, different flowers bloom.”

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: My grandmother made this when Lizzie was born. She gave it to me before she died. That was over 8 years ago, but I still really miss her. She pulls a thread on the frayed edge of the scarf. It quickly unravels, eating away at the fabric. It snags on embroidered words as they disappear and fall away.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (snarky) I thought you'd bring one of your trophies. Or medals...  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 65.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: You said it had to be something I cared about. Touche. Hallie places the wadded yarn and scarf with the rest. Wren scoops up a handful of dirt and covers their offerin

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (calling out) This is our unveiling. We surrender these items so that we may reveal our true selves.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Anyone else feel like and idiot, or is it just me? Hallie and Chloe exchange a look, and Chloe snickers. Wren glares at them and places her iPad over the sacrific items in the decayed hallow of the tree. ON SCREEN: A PHOTO OF KATIE.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (looks at the others) Lights out. Wren clicks off her flashlight. The moonlight now sketches their outlines against the darkened forest. Wren steps over and blindfolds Hallie with a necktie. The Chloe. She's about to blindfold herself when she catches Hallie and Chloe peeking.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: AlleyKat said not to look at him. When we ask for Katie’s return, we have to keep our blindfolds on...

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Why? Isn’t it dark enough?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m not doing the blindfold thing... Wren gives them a disapproving look.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 66.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Fine. Let’s all just leave. Forget it. If you don’t want Katie back...

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Fine. Whatever. This is so lame. Wren’s called their bluff. The girls adjust their blindfo Wren puts hers on. The girls reach for each other and hold hands. Then awkwa form a circle as they sit on the ground. Now only darkness and forest sounds surround them. Cricke chirping. Leaves falling softly on the ground. A gentle w rustles the treetops high above.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: How long are we going to give this?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: As long as it takes.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Not as LONG as it takes.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: You haven't given it any time yet.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Yeah, Hallie, come on. They're quiet, for a second.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Blow me. Chloe giggles.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Come on! They're all quiet again. Crickets continue to chirp. Leav continue to rustle... UNTIL SUDDENLY THE WIND STOPS! AND THE WOODS AROUND THEM. CRICKETS STOP CHIRPING. THE LEAVES STOP RUSTLING. Freaked out, Chloe reaches for her blindfold. Wren senses

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep your blindfolds on!  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 67. The girl’s heads turn blindly toward each other in the inexplicable quiet. A moment later, soft and far way...floating on a gentle breeze... A BELL ECHOES IN THE FOREST.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Hear what?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Shhh! Then like a tiny whisper...a blanketed sound...

dialogues.speaker: DEEP IN THE DARKENED WOODS.
dialogues.text: Goosebumps. The girls all turn towards the sound. Listeni The temptation to remove the blindfolds grows as they cla their hands tighter.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (whispering) Did you guys hear that?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: (voice shaking) We shouldn't be doing this!

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: She's right--

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: It’s too late... Hallie and Chloe both reach towards their blindfolds, pul away. But Wren tightens her grip on their hands.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Leave your blindfolds on! It’s started. We have to keep them on!!! THEN A SILENCE LOUDER THAN BEFORE... A stillness...as if the forest were frozen in time...the absence of sound exploding in the girls’ ears. And then they hear it again!  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 68.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE TREES.
dialogues.text: The girls shudder as the sound swells and fills their ear

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep the blindfolds on!! But Chloe finally can’t take it anymore. She lowers her blindfold just enough to see SOMETHING! Suddenly her face goes white and...

dialogues.speaker: SHE SCREAMS
dialogues.text: And bolts from the circle! Into the woods...

dialogues.speaker: WREN/HALLIE
dialogues.text: No!! Chloe!!! Come back! Wren grabs the flashlight and flicks it on. The beam spla across a wall of trees as they run towards the edge of th clearing. - PICK UP ON CHLOE DEEP IN THE WOODS. She runs for her life, racing past low-hanging branches t snap at her legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two weave through the trees, the flashlight leading t way. The underbrush snags on their clothes like thin litt fingers. Tiny grabbing hands. Wren steps past a tree and cuts left as Hallie wrestles w one of the branches trying to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fights through a thicket of thorned branches and find opening between trees. Chloe ducks through and... THWACK! She runs smack into a tree and falls to the groun But it’s not a tree.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 69. Chloe gets up. IT’S A TALL, SLENDER MAN STANDING RIGHT IN FRONT OF HER! His torso is dark and black, like coal. His face white. A blank where his features should be. He "stares" at her. Without eyes. His long arms raise and reach for her... Chloe’s heart races, but she can’t move. Body rigid. Paralyzed. She can’t look away. Staring back at the man towering above her. She begins to...

dialogues.speaker: SCREAM
dialogues.text: And we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wren rushes along searching frantically. THEN SHE HEARS CHLOE’S SCREAM ECHO THROUGH THE FOREST. She circles back with the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: WE SEE SHE IS ALONE NOW. HALLIE IS GONE
dialogues.text: She looks around, fearful. Panicked breaths. The flashlig casting long shadows from the trees that stretch out into darkness all around her.

dialogues.speaker: THEN SHE HEARS SOMETHING IN THE BRUSH
dialogues.text: Wren braces herself...

dialogues.speaker: SCREAMS
dialogues.text: BUT IT’S HALLIE WHO BURSTS OUT OF THE TREES! SCREAMING TO Realizing they’re okay, the girls struggle to catch their breath. They hold onto each other, scanning the darkness. Their breathing like stuttered gasps. Then a sound! Like distant CHIMES. The girls look at each other...  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 70. The chimes become clearer. Like a RING TONE. It grows lou and louder.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: That's Chloe's phone. Just as Hallie says this, her own phone RINGS! She jumps, grabbing at her pocket. Now Wren's phone starts RINGING, too! The three tones coalesce. Blending into a hideous song echoing in their ears. Hallie looks: Unknown caller. She hesitates, then answers...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello? Silence on the other end. Wren answers her phone now. Puts it on SPEAKER:

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREAM EVOLVES INTO VOICES THAT SOUND EERILY FAMILIAR
dialogues.text: It’s Wren’s own voice and Hallie’s... ",..Do you hear that? ...That's Chloe's phone..."

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What the hell? Where's Chloe?!

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: I don't know. She just started running. Like something spooked her. I told that stupid bitch to keep her blindfold on!

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Did you see anything back there?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. Hallie calls through the trees.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 71.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Chloe? ...Chloe?! Wren starts calling for her, too.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Chloe?!! Their voices bounce around the forest and fades away. Then silence returns to our ears. That same absence of so No crickets chirping. No wind rustling the leaves.

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: A branch breaks in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: THEN A FAINT MURMUR COMES FROM THE WOODS
dialogues.text: Wren grabs Hallie by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: THEN ANOTHER MURMUR FROM THE WOODS
dialogues.text: They both hear it now...Could it be Chloe?

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: Hallie and Wren stumble back away from the sound.

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: Almost running now, they fight through brambles and low hanging branches. They finally push through, falling to the ground in the middle of a small trail. Out in the open! Wren focuses the flashlight in front of them, as they scramble back to their feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashlight spotlights her. Dazed and barefoot, she collapses on the path. She holds only one of her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Chloe! You okay?  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 72. Chloe looks up, a distant look in her eyes. Like a shell- shocked veteran. Weathered and beaten.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Jesus, Chloe! You scared us to death! Where’d you go?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: (slowly) I lost a shoe.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: We thought something happened to you... But Chloe is obsessed with her search. She looks down at ground around her. Searching for her lost shoe.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Forget about your Goddamn shoe! Then an awed look on Wren's face. She shines the flashlight on Chloe’s face. Pupils open so wide we can barely see the color of her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You saw him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls walk home. Chloe lags behind.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (to Chloe) Are you okay? Chloe doesn’t make eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I just freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What happened? No response.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you not to take off your blindfold. Did you see him? Finally, Chloe answers.  57 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 73.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Nothing happened. I just got scared, okay?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Something happened! Obviously. You're lying. Why are you lying? Chloe continues on. Tired of Wren's badgering.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Just let it die, Wren. Jesus. Wren will have none of it.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: She's lying and she knows it. Look at her. Something happened back there!

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: You're right. We didn’t get Katie back. That’s what happened... Wren wants to argue more but her street approaches.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: I gotta go. Wren walks off. Hallie and Chloe trudge on. Hallie can see Chloe's still upset. Distracted. A million miles away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens and Hallie steps in. She pauses listening... The sound of the television filters in from the other roo Her family carries on a carefree conversation, but she ca make out the words. We see the exhaustion on Hallie’s face as she takes a dee breath and heads into the living room. INT. HALLIE’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM -- CONTINUOUS Her parents and Lizzie sit on the couch watching TV. She moves quickly, trying to pass by unnoticed...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hallie?  58 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 74. But fails. HALLIE’S FATHER Hey sweetheart. How was practice? Shit! Hallie’s eyes give it away. She forgot about track practice. Covers...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Great! Her Father smiles. Before this gets any worse, Hallie mak quick exit.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got some homework... A wrinkle on Lizzie’s forehead shows she can sense someth is up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is silent. Hallie sits on the bed not reading from an opened textboo her lap. We can almost see the evening’s events playing b in her mind. Then a knock at her door.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hal? Lizzie peeks in. Hallie quickly pretends to be studying.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I come in? Hallie puts on a smile for her little sister.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Give me fifteen. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: Okay... Lizzie steps back out. Shuts the door behind her.  59 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 75. Hallie picks up her cell. Calls Chloe. Gets voice mail.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Chlo, hey, I was just... Call me, okay? She hangs up. Unsettled. Isolated in her lonely bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chloe stares at her PHONE, pacing around the room. MISSED CALL FROM HALLIE. For a moment, she considers calling back. But only for a moment. She fidgets with her hands, wringing them out. We a manic look in her eyes as she takes a deep breath. Chloe opens the music player on her phone and plays a son soothing rhythm fills the air. She lays on her bed and closes her eyes. Trying to calm herself. Deep breath after breath. She exhales pure anxie but it helps. Another breath and we see the nerves calm. We watch the tension release. Her body relaxing into the bed beneath her.

dialogues.speaker: THEN A HIGH PITCHED SOUND INTERRUPTS THE SONG
dialogues.text: Chloe jumps. Her eyes pop open. Listening. But the song continues. Like it didn’t happen. Slowly she relaxes again, closing her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NOTE
dialogues.text: The sound shocks Chloe to her feet. She grabs the phone and hits stop. But it does nothing. She stamps at the screen and the sou disappears. Now just the same quiet song as before. Silence and relie she exhales. At that same moment, her phone DINGS! There’s a blank mes with an attachment.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 76. Chloe freezes, staring at the screen. Her finger hovering over the attachment. - SHE CLICKS ON TO SEE: A live-streaming view of her hous Chloe can be seen in one of the windows. When she turns t look out the window, the fear in her eyes is plainly visi Chloe sees nobody on the other side. Only black empty voi - But her fear only grows as the stalking POV of the vide playing in her palm moves even closer to the house! Chloe looks outside again. Still no one. Impossible. - ON THE SCREEN: The POV stalks around the front of her house. RIGHT UP TO THE FRONT DOOR! -— THEN A MOMENT OF BLACK AND SOMEHOW THE MOVING POV IS I

dialogues.speaker: THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Chloe rushes to her bedroom door. Again checks her phone: - The relentless, unknown POV glides through the living r past her mother...CLOSER AND CLOSER. THEN IT STOPS OUTSIDE CHLOE’S BEDROOM DOOR! Chloe trembles as the "Mystery POV" stops shy. Waiting... hesitates. Then reaches slowly for her door knob and open find... The hallway is empty.

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY
dialogues.text: -— THEN THAT HIGH PITCHED SOUND! !

dialogues.speaker: STANDING RIGHT BEHIND HER
dialogues.text: Chloe spins around... But nothing is there. She drops the phone. Horrified. Onl notice something on the back of her hand... A dark red pulpy mass, spreading slowly. Horrified, she scratches at it. Then feels something on h arm. She pulls back her sleeve and gasps when she sees...  61 62 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 77.

dialogues.speaker: QUICKLY
dialogues.text: Hysterical she drops the phone and moves to the mirror in room. She looks... THE LESIONS QUICKLY TRAVEL ACROSS HER NECK AND FACE. Chloe looks down at her hands. Both completely covered. S pulls up her shirt. They are everywhere. Horrified, she l back into the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: THE DARK FIGURE STANDS RIGHT BEHIND HER IN THE REFLECTION
dialogues.text: Before she can even scream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sun creeps over the horizon, the bell RINGS to sta new day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie tries to concentrate. But struggles with a precalc problem. She scratches out her work and starts over.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: , (whispers) Hey? Hallie looks up to see Tom in the next row. He looks over Chloe’s EMPTY CHAIR.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispers) What’s up with Chloe? It’s been a few days... Hallie shrugs, now nervous and avoiding eye contact. Acro the way. Wren comes to the rescue...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (whispers) She’s fine. Just a cold... Tom nods and focuses back on his notebook. Wren locks eyes with Hallie. Gives her a “Get your shit together!” look.  63 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie exits one of the school buildings. She texts Chloe response. She continues walking, head buried in her phone until...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Wait up... Tom comes jogging up next to her. Hallie’s caught off gua

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How you holding up? I mean with Katie and all...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Uh, well, you know...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I got an idea that might cheer you up.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: You do? Hallie can’t help smile, enjoying the newfound attention.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It’s Friday. We got the weekend off. So I was thinking... We should do something? Hallie can't believe it. She tries to nod casually. Miraculously, Tom doesn’t seem to notice how excited she

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Sure... Why not? Cool. Hallie glances away self-consciously, trying to hide the giddiness. But it quickly fades when she sees... THE TREELINE IN THE DISTANCE.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Want to hang out tonight? Hallie doesn’t even hear the question. THERE’S SOMETHING ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE SCHOOL’S CHAIN

dialogues.speaker: LINK FENCE
dialogues.text: Cherry Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 79. A tall dark silhouette. Static. Quietly staring. Too far to make out any detail. It looks like a man, but with something spreading out from its sides. LIKE TREE BRANCHES, BUT TANGLED AND MOVING.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hallie... This turns Hallie’s attention back to Tom. Distracted, sh tries to play it off.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I mean, yeah. Your place? Tom considers that victory.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Cool. See you later in Bio. Hallie nods. Tom starts to move off to some other friends and glances as if to wave goodbye. But Hallie’s attention has drifted again into the distance. Hallie refocuses on the treeline. The fence bordering the school. The exact same spot the man was standing just a moment before. Nothing there now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blanket of silence surrounds us. Wren sits quietly typing at one of the library computers. - ON THE SCREEN: Search results for “paranormal research studies”. A list populates and we scroll through. Wren spots an entry and writes down a call number. PN350.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Books line the shelves deep in the stacks of the library.  Cherry Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 80. Wren travels down an empty aisle, fingers trailing along books. It’s so quiet we can hear her fingers drag across spines. We can hear each footstep pad softly on the carpe Various titles slide by. She stops at the end of the aisl and pulls one of the books. BIOELECTRIC SYSTEMS AND THE PARANORMAL. The binding groans as it opens. Hasn’t been touched in ye Concentration on her face, as she flips through the pages A faint sound breaks the silence. CREAK-CREAK-CREAK-CREAK Wren listens as the sound grows louder. Repeating faster. Then through the books, we see MOVEMENT ON THE OTHER SIDE Wren watches as the movement reaches her end of the aisle Now, only a few feet away. About to round the corner when A LIBRARIAN’S CART COMES INTO VIEW. One last CREAK and it stops. The LIBRARIAN grabs a book and slides it back onto a shel Then he grabs the cart and wheels it away. Silence again as Wren focuses back on the book. Then a realization on her face as she skims the pages. She pulls phone from her pocket and quickly dials a number. We listen with her as it rings... Then a soft click. But no answer.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (whispering) Hello? Chloe...? Then a strange sound nearby. BZZZZ2Z2Z2T... Wren looks down the aisle to a bank of fluorescent lights flickering in the far corner. The buzzing grows louder as they struggle to stay lit. WREN’S POV - BZZZT! The light shorts out. A single spark falls from the fixture. Confusion on Wren’s face as she watches the tiny spark fl to the floor and snuff out on the carpet. Wren turns to where the Librarian was just moments ago.  Cherry Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 81.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calling out) Hey, the lights are-

dialogues.speaker: DOWN, SMOLDERING ON THE CARPET
dialogues.text: Wren flinches as the far corner goes dark.

dialogues.speaker: WAY ACROSS THE ROOM... TOWARDS WREN
dialogues.text: Wren starts to back away, the book falling from her hands

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: WREN’S HEAD... Wren slowly looks up.

dialogues.speaker: COMPLETE DARKNESS
dialogues.text: An involuntary scream escapes Wren’s throat. It carries o into the empty void surrounding her. And then nothing. On silence. In a panic, she uses her phone as a flashlight a scans the aisle behind her. WREN’S POV - It’s too dark to make it out, but there is t faint outline of a tall static figure at the other end.

dialogues.speaker: IS SOMETHING STANDING THERE...
dialogues.text: Wren backs away. WREN’S POV - THE TALL STATIC FIGURE JUST STANDS THERE... STARING AT HER... Wren strains to make it out. And then... IT MOVES!! The figure slides towards us.

dialogues.speaker: HANGING AT ITS SIDES
dialogues.text: Wren screams and bolts out of the aisle. WREN’S POV - The light from the phone reaches into blackn Spotlighting an endless row of books that leads into noth Wren races through the darkness, the phone spotting the w ahead. Books fly past, the light flashing across them.  Cherry Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 82.

dialogues.speaker: THEN THE AISLE ENDS
dialogues.text: She ducks into another aisle.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Help!! No answer. Her voice just carries out into darkness as sh races past the books.

dialogues.speaker: THEN THAT AISLE ENDS
dialogues.text: She turns another corner. Rows of books endlessly streaki past. We hear Wren’s rapid breaths. Her footsteps poundin

dialogues.speaker: SHE REACHES THE END OF THE AISLE AGAIN
dialogues.text: IT’S LIKE A MAZE IN THE DARK!! WHICH WAY!? Wren flashes the light around her. Nothing but stacks of books everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: JUST LINES OF SHELVES LEADING INTO DARKNESS
dialogues.text: Desperate, she just picks a direction. The light shakes a she runs, only carrying a few strides ahead. SUDDENLY, THE BEAM OF LIGHT FLASHES ACROSS SOMETHING...

dialogues.speaker: AND TIE, STARING FROM A HORRIBLY BLANK, FEATURELESS FACE
dialogues.text: Wren tries to stop and slides to the floor. WE HEAR WREN’S BLOOD CURDLING SCREAM AS THE FIGURE MOVES

dialogues.speaker: TOWARDS HER
dialogues.text: A chaotic sweep of light splashes across the figure as Wr scrambles to her feet. She reverses direction, in a full sprint. Only the phone spotting the way ahead. Aisle after aisle fly past as she races aimlessly. Turnin right, turning left. LOST IN THE MAZE, UNTIL...

dialogues.speaker: EVERY FLUORESCENT FIXTURE ABOVE INSTANTLY BLAZES WITH LIG
dialogues.text: Books fly in all directions as the darkness is washed awa  65 Cherry Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 83.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIBRARIAN'S CART TUMBLES TO THE FLOOR IN FRONT OF HER
dialogues.text: The librarian stands frozen, book in hand. Eyes wide. Sta at a raving lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: LIBRARIAN
dialogues.text: Young lady, are you okay? Panting and out of breath, Wren quickly looks around. EVERYTHING IS BACK TO NORMAL. Just a quiet library. Nothi behind her. Nothing chasing her. Wren sits there, head spinning. Catching her breath. And then something catches her eye... WREN’S POV: A book scattered on the floor. “BIOELECTRIC SYSTEMS AND THE PARANORMAL” Wren grabs it and scrambles to her feet. The librarian stands in shock, just staring as Wren runs and disappears around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie is on her way to track practice. Wren marches up. Obviously distraught.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: You didn't get my messages?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: My phone’s in my locker.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Okay... Please, just listen to me. I ran all the way here. Wren hands are TREMBLING. Hallie's never seen her like th

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I understand now. Hallie looks around. Not wanting to draw attention.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What AlleyKat was trying to tell me...it’s proof! Wren shows Hallie the book from the library. She opens it a marked page.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 84.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Paranormal contact with bioelectric systems often result in a SYMBIOTIC RELATIONSHIP. The effects on host organisms have been well documented and manifest in various forms... personality change, bizarre behavior, mental illness, psychosis, loss of contact with reality, hallucination, self mutilation, suicide, and NONSPECIFIC DISSOLUTION. (looks at Hallie) They just disappear. People start to look their way.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Wren. Chill...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: It’s exactly like AlleyKat said. When you contact him, it becomes part of you. Like a virus. But one you can’t get rid of! Wren tries to catch her breath.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Has anything weird happened to you? Anything strange? Hallie hesitates. Wren sees it.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do not hold out on me bitch...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Okay. I was talking to Tom between classes--

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (negative) Tom?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with Tom?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I thought I saw something in the trees.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: It was him. Hallie protests.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I didn’t say that. It could have been anything...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (please...) It was him! (beat) What about Chloe? Have you talked to her?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Her mom keeps saying she’s sick. Last time I called, she pretty much flat-out told me to stay away.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: We need to go see her right now... Hallie looks around.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I have practice. I can’t just leave-

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (quote fingers) I thought you didn’t care about track? With that Wren walks off. But tosses back for good measur

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call me when you grow a conscience. Gauntlet thrown. Hallie thinks for a beat. Makes a decision... 66 EXT. CHLOE’S HOUSE -- DAY 66 Near dusk. Hallie and Wren stand across from Chloe’s hous Hallie pulls out her cell. Calls Chloe again. No answer. texts her. No response.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 86.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Chloe hasn’t answered a single text or call. You know that’s not like her. Something’s definitely up. We gotta talk to her...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Her mom’s gonna run interference.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Duh! That’s why we gotta go around the side. Knock on her window, moron... Hallie nods “Okay”. And the two move toward the house. As quietly as possible, they duck down beneath the living room window. Peek in to see: Chloe's Mother sitting on a in a dim den. Her shoulders slumped in a wreath of cigare smoke. They move on to Chloe’s room now. Wren cups her hands ove her eyes to see better. But no luck. She shakes her head. Can’t see anything. Until...

dialogues.speaker: PALE
dialogues.text: AND DOESN’T SEEM TO NOTICE HER FRIENDS! IN FACT, LOOKS RI THROUGH THEM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is nearly down. A shaken Wren and Hallie regroup the block.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Did you see that? She looked right through us! Like we weren’t there... Hallie did see. Tries to make sense of it all...

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She saw him! In the woods. I knew it... SUDDENLY, HALLIE'S PHONE RINGS. They both stop in their tracks.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 87.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: It's Chloe. Hallie shows Wren the phone. We see the name. The accompanying photo. A tiny selfie of Chloe. The way they remember her, smiling up at them from screen. Hallie answers. Puts it on speaker.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello. But there’s only silence.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello? Chloe? We hear shuffling on the other end of the line. Then a fa murmur. Something that sounds like crying. A soft whimper

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now I know...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Chloe? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s happening all the time...He won’t go away... The words come fast. Wren interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Chloe? Who? No response.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chloe, are you there? Chloe mumbles again. As the girls strain to hear..

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He won’t stop...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What does he want? (beat) Chloe...Chloe are you there? Silence. Then we hear Chloe crying.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16)

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Don't ever call me again. CALL ENDED. She hangs up. Wren and Hallie look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What the hell was that? They look in the direction of Chloe's house. 88. The sky burns orange above the dark suburban street. A st light flicks on. Darkness will be here soon. Hallie makes a decision. Walks away.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't want to do this anymore.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: I don't either! But I'm stuck in it. You're stuck in it, too. You just don't know it yet.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What am I stuck in?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What we started. Hello? Hallie crosses her arms.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't look at me like that. I'm not doing a "thing."

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: All right...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: And don't say "All right” like that to me. This is real Goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Nope. I’m done. No more games.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: It’s not a game. Don’t you get it? (beat) We only saw the website video. But Chloe... She saw HIM in the woods!  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 89.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (uncertain) She said...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: She said what exactly? Hallie’s truly reached her limit.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I'm not going to let you keep dragging me into this craziness.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: You think I created this situation?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I think you love the drama...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Read the book I showed you. You’1ll see the body count. Thousands of disappearances. Search parties... Faces on milk cartons... I’m not making this shit up. It all happened EXACTLY like AlleyKat said...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: AlleyKat93, of course. The expert who knows everything. Funny you didn't talk about this body count stuff before. Wren stammers a bit, thrown off balance by that...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: It was all hearsay then. Just talk. But now it’s not just her saying it. It’s right there in black and white. And Alleykat knows first hand...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. And she’s probably some 50- year-old horny dude living in someone's basement, getting off on emailing back and forth with teenage girls...Ya ever think of that? Did you? And with that, Hallie turns her back to leave. Wren gets really angry now.  68 69 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 90.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: You think you can just go back to real life?!

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (tosses back) Yeah. I do. In fact, I have a “real life” date with “real life” Tom tonight. In real life... Wren takes this like a gunshot. And Hallie escalates the insult by continuing to walk away... Wren shouts after her-

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: You heard what Chloe said! He’s not going to stop! And going on a date with Abercrombie Tom can’t change that! Hallie almost turns around. But instead throws her arm up the air. Flips Wren off.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know I’m right!! But Hallie just walks away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie makes final adjustments in the mirror. Tries to fo about her tiff with Wren. Determined that all is, and wil be, normal. INT. HALLIE’S HOUSE - DINING ROOM -- NIGHT 69 Hallie heads out. Past the dining room where her parents Lizzie eat. HALLIE’S MOTHER Not joining us for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Can’t. Got plans. Hallie resumes her exit. But- HALLIE’S FATHER Hold on a second...  70 71 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 91. Hallie can hear it in her father’s tone. He’s not happy. turns back. HALLIE’S FATHER (CONT’D) Coach Sanders called. Said you walked out on practice today. And missed one last week. What’s going on? Busted. But Hallie’s emotional right now and going on thi date if it kills her.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I gotta go. HALLIE’S MOTHER Honey... We’re just asking-- But Hallie’s out the door. So confused and agitated by al that’s happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking her makeup, Hallie knocks on the front door. Tom opens it moments later. Happy to see her.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Sorry I’m late...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No. Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie flashes an anxious smile and follows Tom in. She avoids eye contact trying to keep the excitement at bay.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I thought I had the wrong house. There aren't any cars in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah, my dad's on a business thing. And my mom went someplace with some friends of hers.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Nobody's home?  72 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 92. She hesitates just long enough to show it makes her nervo

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Just us. That okay?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie checks out Tom’s collection of comic books, Fan Bo figurines, and Sci Fi movie paraphernalia.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (smiling) I didn’t know you were a nerd...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah... I wasn’t always this handsome. Hallie laughs. They sit on a comfy couch. An old turntabl spins a vinyl record around and around. A simple vocal ov soulful rhythm fills the air. Hallie casts sidelong glances at Tom, who seems to really into the song.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen to that sound... Hallie nods, pretending she gets it. Her eyes wander arou the room. She focuses on the impressive collection of vin records stacked on shelves.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: That’s a lot of records.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah, most of them are my dad's, but the newer stuff is mine... He gestures to the current song.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You want me to put something else on?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: No, this is great.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 93. Then a pause in the conversation. An opportunity... Tom finally makes his move and kisses her. Hallie falls b into the couch, running her fingers through his hair. Tom starts to round the bases, hands exploring. And for a moment, Hallie doesn’t resist. But then pushes back, slowing it down. Taking control.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You okay? She nods and a big smile appears on her face. They slowly ease back on the sofa as the music continues in the background. Then just as Hallie closes her eyes and lets herself go...

dialogues.speaker: A HIGH PITCHED SOUND
dialogues.text: Hallie turns to look at the speakers.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Do you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Good. Right? Tom doesn’t seem to notice. Hallie scans the room, ears w open. Listening. But the music returns to normal.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come here... He pulls Hallie closer. But just as she turns back... TOM'S FACE HAS CHANGED!! IT’S NOW JUST A VAGUE SUGGESTION SOMETHING HUMAN, DISAPPEARING INTO A BLANK VISAGE.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE SHRIEKS AND PUSHES AWAY
dialogues.text: Tom disappears as the room seems to warp and expand impossibly around her. The music devolves into the same h pitched noise we’ve heard before. Screaming from the speakers. Louder and louder as the room transforms. And i the chaos...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE SCREAMS
dialogues.text: Then instantly...WE GO BACK TO REALITY. Tom jumps off Hallie like he's been electrocuted. Hallie bolts upright.  73 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 94.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell? Hallie’s eyes dart around the room. Checking all four corners. But everything has returned to normal. Except Tom is now looking at her like she’s a complete lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (still confused) What?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything!

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (mortified) I know. Tom relaxes. She catches her breath.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Hallie looks at him. Long story...

dialogues.speaker: LATER 73
dialogues.text: Tom comes back in the room with a glass of water. Hands i Hallie. Takes a look at her phone.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Have you told anybody about this? She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If Katie was on a weird Slender Man site, who knows who she met there? Probably some guy with a van. I hate to say it... He starts tapping on her phone, searching for something.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) Is this it? Hallie looks up and sees what he's doing.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 95.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Don't! That “How to Summon Slender Man” video starts to play.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I've never seen this one...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Tom, don't! He looks at her, startled. She jumps up, grabs for her ph He reflexively holds it out at arm's length.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can't watch it. Promise me you won't watch it. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It’s just a video--

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (interrupting) No. Really. YOU HAVE TO PROMISE ME!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (starts to laugh) Okay, I won't...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I’m not kidding. Promise me. Tom is dubious but can see she’s serious. He gives Hallie back her phone.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Okay. I promise... Hallie looks at him, anxiety dancing in her eyes. He pull her close. Tries to give comfort.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Really. Finally, she nods thinking he just might mean it.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Okay, well... I should probably go. One last kiss and Tom walks her to the front door.  76 77 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 96. INT. HALLIE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 76 Hallie bursts in and drops her things on the bed. Half of scatters onto the floor. She takes a deep breath trying to calm. In the bedroom mi Hallie sees the desperation in her eyes. The fear on her face. She’s almost unrecognizable to herself. Finally she breaks. Sobbing. She turns away so she can’t the tears and lets it all go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie drifts unnoticed through a seemingly endless crowd students. Emotionless. Completely torn down. Until she tu the corner and sees...

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Chloe carries books like any other student, but something different. Her skin so pale. Except for the make-up caked her face. Like a corpse prepared for an open casket funer

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Chloe... She passes, without acknowledging Hallie's presence. Hall turns to go after her.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chloe! Wait! What's going on? Chloe stops. Turns to Hallie with a crazed and paranoid l on her face.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Something happened... To you. And Katie, I guess. Something's going to happen to me. And Wren, too. Isn't it? No response.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is it already happening? I've seen things? I can’t explain it... A thin smile creeps across Chloe’s face. She breaks into strange laugh. We see the confusion on Hallie’s face as s watches Chloe drift into a crowded hallway.  78 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An EYE stares up at us from a metal tray. A COW’S EYE. Biology class. STUDENTS are lined up at different tables cow eyes in front of them. SCALPELS AND SCISSORS in hand. Hallie sees Wren. Who looks the other way. Then sees Chlo two tables over silently staring out the window. The scal hanging from her hand.

dialogues.speaker: BIOLOGY TEACHER
dialogues.text: Hey, look who decided to show up! We see Tom duck into the room. Distracted and out of brea like he was being chased. Hallie smiles as he comes closer. But he just slips past, taking the open stool at the end of her table. Wren scowls... BIOLOGY TEACHER (CONT’D) All right, first, take a moment to observe the external anatomy... Hallie leans back to draw Tom’s attention. He still seems not acknowledge she's there. She whispers-

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Hey. He doesn't respond. Hallie faces forward as the teacher w by.

dialogues.speaker: BIOLOGY TEACHER
dialogues.text: The cornea looks cloudy and bluish because of the preservation process... Hallie looks at the cloudy, bluish eye then back to Tom. BIOLOGY TEACHER (CONT’D) Now slice as evenly as you can through the sclera to separate the anterior features of the eye... Around Hallie, students are cutting now. Including Chloe. speaks louder this time-

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Tom! He looks. Seems to notice her for the first time.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 98.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you okay? It takes him half a beat but he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m fine. Hallie nods but can see Tom’s smile is short-lived. He lo harried. Hallie’s about to say something else to him but interrupted by a...

dialogues.speaker: LOUD GASP
dialogues.text: Hallie turns to see kids backing away from one of the tab Chloe’s table. We see confusion on Hallie’s face. Chloe just stands there, alone at the table. Oblivious to other kids backing away. The commotion spreads like a wav through the classroom. Then Hallie sees... Chloe cutting herself! Drawing the point of her scalpel across her palm as if testing its sharpness! Blood pours the table. And then...

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE HOLDS THE SCALPEL UP TO HER EYE
dialogues.text: We hear chairs scooting. Kids jumping to their feet. Hall eyes widen, frozen in the moment. Chloe studies the blade for a long beat, a sinister smile her face. And then...

dialogues.speaker: SHE STABS
dialogues.text: As we cut away there are SCREAMS!!! Hallie and Wren just stands there. Watching. Paralyzed wi terror as the Teacher grabs for Chloe. Desperately trying pry the scalpel out of her hands...

dialogues.speaker: OH MY GOD
dialogues.text: We watch as the class erupts into chaos! Students rushing of the room screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARAMEDICS wheel Chloe to an ambulance. With tears streaming down, Hallie and Wren watch Chloe disappear behind the ambulance doors. For a moment, Tom stands behind them. We see the fear on face. Then he slowly slips away behind the gathering crow Wren and Hallie lock eyes. The nightmare is only getting worse...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: I told you... (crying hysterically) I told you and you wouldn’t believe me. Hallie just stands there, shaking. Tears pour from her ey as the ambulance’s lights and siren slowly fade away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie races upstairs. Her Mother in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hallie, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Lizzie told us about Chloe... Hallie stops.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can't believe it. You were there? Did you see her do it? Hallie can’t speak. She can’t find the words. HALLIE'S MOTHER (CONT’D) Oh my God. That poor girl. Hallie’s mother doesn’t know the half of it.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I need to lie down... She trails off. Her Mother nods.  81 82 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 100.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Of course. I’m so sorry. She gives Hallie a hug. Senses something... HALLIE’S MOTHER Are you okay? Hallie nods. HALLIE’S MOTHER (CONT’D) Because your sister’s taking it very hard. I’m worried about her. She hasn’t come out of her room since she got home...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I'm just tired. HALLIE’S MOTHER Can I get you anything? Hallie shakes her head and keeps going. INT. HALLIE’S BEDROOM -- LATER 81 Hallie’s computer sits in her lap. That ominous Slender M website up on the screen. She types a message in the chat window. TO ALLEYKAT93: “You have to help us!” The cursor blinks. No response. She tries again: “How do you make him go away?” She press send. Adds: "PLEASE!!!" But gets an automatic response: “USER ACCOUNT DISCONTINUE On Hallie. We see hope fade and the fear return...

dialogues.speaker: LATER 82
dialogues.text: Hallie lies in bed. Eyes fixed on a framed photo that sit her bedside table: Herself, Wren, Katie and Chloe in a go selfie from happier times. She looks at the picture as if it were a distant memory. Then... SPORADIC SOBS OUT IN THE HALL. HER PARENTS WHISPERING.  83 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 101. Hallie sits up-

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S FATHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come on. Just breathe, Lizzie. INT. HALLIE’S HOUSE - HALLWAY/BATHROOM -- CONTINUOUS 83 Hallie moves through the dark hallway, towards a light in bathroom. We hear Lizzie crying. Her parents urgent voice Hallie’s almost running now. She reaches the half-open door and sees her Father tendin Lizzie. Lizzie’s struggling to breathe. Hallie's Mother stands by feeling helpless.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: She can’t breathe. We have to get her to the emergency room. Lizzie gulps for air.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Lizzie? Oh my God... Lizzie looks up with swollen red eyes. Tears streak down pale skin on her face. Her hands tremble. HALLIE’S FATHER The ambulance is on its way... Hallie's Father starts bundling Lizzie in a towel. Hallie watches helplessly as he carries Lizzie past her. HALLIE’S MOTHER It’s okay, baby... Lizzie begins to lose consciousness, her eyes rolling bac her head! Hallie rushes over.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Lizzie! Wake up!!

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S FATHER
dialogues.text: We’re all here, Lizzie.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Where’s that ambulance?!  84 87 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 102. Finally, we hear SIRENS in the distance. INT. LIZZIE’'S HOSPITAL ROOM -- NIGHT 84 Lizzie’s bed sits in a pool of harsh light. Pale skin and dark eyes. The vital signs monitor tracks her pulse. Hallie sits bedside listening to her Mother cry as the do tells them Lizzie had a MASSIVE ANXIETY ATTACK. Hallie’s father steps over shielding Hallie from the deta HALLIE’S FATHER Hallie, give us a minute. Why don’t you go get your Mother something to drink...? Hallie’s father hands her some money and motions to the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie taps away on her phone as she walks towards a vend machine at the end of the hallway. She sends a text to To ON THE PHONE: “YOU AROUND?” Hallie comes to the end of the hallway. No answer... She punches a button on the vending machine, a lost look her eyes as the soda tumbles out. She grabs it and turns walk away. But as she does... Hallie sees an ORDERLY step out of a room down the hall. Outside the room is a cluster of BALLOONS... THE NAME “CHLOE” ON ONE OF THEM. Hallie’s feet slow as she approaches the open doorway. Slowly, she peeks inside. POV - A curtain sections off the room. INT. CHLOE’S HOSPITAL ROOM -- CONTINUOUS 87 The curtain slides back. Hallie enters to see “Get well” cards and flowers.  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 103. BUT THE BED IS EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: RASPY VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hallie? Hallie startles! For a moment she can’t locate her, but f Chloe sitting by the window in a wheelchair. Her eyes are bandaged with thick pads of gauze.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Chloe. Oh my God. How’d you know it was-—-

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I can smell your perfume... Hallie doesn’t see the sinister grin creeping across Chlo face as she moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Are you okay? A tiny laugh escapes Chloe’s throat. A hideous, dry rasp.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: (grins morbidly) I tried to stop it. But it didn't work... Chloe reaches up and picks at one of the bandages.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: No. Don't do that! Hallie tries to stop her hands, but Chloe pushes her away

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I realize now. He’1ll never stop.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE RIPS THE GAUZE FROM HER FACE
dialogues.text: The bandages fall away and we see...

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I can still see!

dialogues.speaker: I CAN STILL SEE
dialogues.text: 88 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 104. The horrific stare turns Hallie for the door and the scre chase her into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie rushes away. Past the nurse’s station. Back to Lizzie's room... Her parents are gone. No doctors and nurses. We see distr on Hallie's face and then... SHE GASPS. LIZZIE’S BODY IS COVERED IN A WHITE SHEET! The hum from the lights fill our ears as Hallie slowly pa over to the bed. Hallie reaches towards the rigid body. Hands trembling. Slowly, she pulls back the white sheet and reveals a face

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: No... Hallie gently touches her hand to Lizzie’s face.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lizzie...come on...wake up... Her voice falters. She shakes her sister.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lizzie... But it does nothing. Hallie starts to cry. Tears flowing. Dripping from her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No... Then we see a single tear come from Lizzie’s eye. Hallie wipes the tear. Then Lizzie’s face twitches! A microscopic movement. A tiny muscle contraction under o of Lizzie’s eyes. Hallie see it and a burst of hope appears on her face.  92 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 105.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lizzie! LIZZIE’S FACE TWITCHES AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wake up! Lizzie’s eyes still don’t open, but the muscles begin to twitch all over now. Contorting Lizzie’s face. Strange expressions of unknown emotions. Hallie shakes her again. AND LIZZIE’S HEAD FALLS TO THE SIDE. HER MOUTH HANGING OP Like she’s going to say something! Hallie stares at her, waiting for the words. Lizzie’s lip begin to move and we see... A GIANT BUG CRAWL OUT OF HER MOUTH. Hallie jumps back and screams! THEN ANOTHER BUG EMERGES... AND ANOTHER...Lizzie’s face bubbles under the skin. Rippling like water. Expanding an contracting until...

dialogues.speaker: HER EYELIDS OPEN. BUT THERE ARE NO EYES. ONLY BUGS
dialogues.text: They burrow out from under the skin on Lizzie’s face. We them scurrying and gnawing their way through. Hundreds crawling out of the flesh. HALLIE BACKS AWAY HORRIFIED! Turns to run...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hallie? You okay? Hallie tries to comprehend. Looks over and sees Lizzie sleeping in bed. Struggling but still with us. Emotion overwhelms Hallie. She can’t keep it in anymore. Her Mother and Father look at each other, confused. HALLIE’S FATHER Hallie, we're worried about you. You haven’t been yourself lately.  94 95 96 Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 106. She looks into her parents’ eyes. They’1l never believe h if she told them. Hallie bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded hallway. Kids make their way to class like it w any other day. Moving on, like nothing has happened. Hallie walks with her head down. Trying not to see anythi Or anyone. Fearful of more visions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie enters, distant and distracted. Her Biology Teache welcomes everyone back. With a heavy heart. Hallie sees Wren. An emotional, loaded beat. Then notices Tom is absent. We can see the anxiety flickering inside. She grabs her p and texts him... Hallie: Where are you? She stares at the screen. No message back. Hallie is abou message him again when...

dialogues.speaker: A WAVE OF CONFUSION RUSHES THROUGH THE CLASSROOM
dialogues.text: Hallie and Wren look up to see kids out of their seats. A the windows. Whispering. Pointing... With tentative steps, the girls cross over to the windows It’s almost like they know what they’re about to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM STANDS ON THE LEDGE OF THE BELL TOWER! High above the ground... Leaning out, eyes locked on the ground below. Like he’s g to jump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wren and her classmates just stand there, shocked and confused. Staring out the windows. Hallie charges past. Rushes out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd of STUDENTS, TEACHERS, and SECURITY have gathered below the tower. Looking up at Tom. Calling 911. Begging to come down. Begging him not to jump... Hallie comes running.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (yells up to him)

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Tom spots Hallie fighting her way through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tom... WHAT ARE YOU DOING?!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (yells down)

dialogues.speaker: YOU WERE RIGHT, HALLIE
dialogues.text: The crowd's attention quickly shifts to Hallie. Collectiv waiting for an answer. Right about what?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: And that’s when Tom makes it clear...

dialogues.speaker: BUT I SEE HIM
dialogues.text: Shit! He watched the video... We hear SIRENS. EMERGENCY RESPONDERS on the way. TOM’S POV: In the distance, at the edge of the woods stan blurred figure. Tall and slender. Arms outstretched like branches of a tree. Beckoning...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: IT’S OKAY! COME DOWN! TOM, PLEASE!

dialogues.speaker: STOP THIS
dialogues.text: BACK ON TOM: A realization appears on his face. An unnatu look of joy...  Blue Rev. (06/09/16) 108.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGHTENED VOICES CRY OUT FROM THE CROWD
dialogues.text: AS TOM’S BODY CRASHES TO THE GROUND!!! AND HALLIE SCREAMS!! A study in shock and terror. Tears streaming down her face. Frozen in this nightmare...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie wanders aimlessly like a lost child. Walking down hallway that feels like it stretches out forever. A round of laughter draws her attention to one of the roo Inside the room, a family jokes around, cheering up a lit girl in a hospital bed. All smiles as a nurse prepares th tiny patient for release. But the smiles bring sadness to Hallie’s eyes. She starts cry, the weight of everything crumbling around her. We can see the pain in Hallie’s eyes as we follow her aro the corner. Then we hear SHRIEKS from down the hallway. Hallie sees nurses hurrying towards a hospital room. RUSHING INTO LIZZIE’S ROOM! Hallie moves quicker now. Almost running as she reaches t door. Inside the room... IT IS LIZZIE SHRIEKING. OUT OF CONTROL. Hallie’s Mother and Father look up as Hallie steps into t room. We see the panic in their eyes. The tears. INT. LIZZIE’S HOSPITAL ROOM -- CONTINUOUS A DOCTOR stands over Lizzie reading her vital signs. He b orders at the NURSES who respond immediately. Efficient l a machine. Working in unison.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Let's get her moving. The railing slides up on the sides of Lizzie’s bed. The wheels release. An IV is attached to a hanger. And suddenly, Lizzie is being wheeled towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Where are they taking her? She rushes over, grabbing Lizzie’s bed. Hallie’s Father s her, letting the nurses pass. HALLIE’S FATHER Hallie, they’ve got to get her to the ICU... MORE SCREAMS from Lizzie. Her face paler than before.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Lizzie! Hallie pulls away from her father and grabs Lizzie’s hand Lizzie sees Hallie.

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogues.text: (hisses) He didn’t have a face! TERROR WASHES OVER HALLIE WHEN SHE HEARS THE WORDS... And then Lizzie’s hand is ripped away. The hospital bed rolling towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Lizzie! As they exit the room.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lizzie!! Hallie’s Father wraps his arms around her as they watch Lizzie disappear. Tears fall from Hallie’s face as the fear builds inside. see it growing in her eyes. Overwhelming her. And then it too much... Hallie breaks. Bursting into tears. Fearing the worst. Sh pulls away from her father. Heads for the door...

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: 99 Tan Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 110. EXT. HALLIE’S HOUSE - LIZZIE’S BEDROOM -- NIGHT 99 Hallie charges through the door, searching. LIZZIE’S LAPTOP SITS ON THE DESK IN THE CORNER. Hallie rushes over and taps on the keyboard. The screen lights up and we see...

dialogues.speaker: THAT OMINOUS RED-ON-BLACK WEBSITE
dialogues.text: A wave of dread washes over her as the realization sinks - ON THE SCREEN: We see Lizzie’s conversations with other users. As we scroll through, a name catches Hallie’s eye. “WREN” HALLIE OPENS THE THREAD. IN THE FEED: Questions from Lizzie. Answers from Wren. Wh Slender Man? What does he do? How does he find you? Hallie scrolls down to the last entry... THERE’S A VIDEO LINK!! Hallie clicks and it loads... - IN THE VIDEO: The camera moves through the trees. We he SWEET LAUGH from behind the camera. Barely audible. Then girl appears, walking away from us. We follow her into a clearing. She stops and faces the camera. Hallie freezes, horrified when she realizes...IT’S LIZZIE - We hear Lizzie giggle.

dialogues.speaker: THEN HALLIE SEES IT
dialogues.text: -— SOMEONE HANDS THE CAMERA TO LIZZIE. WE CAN NOW SEE PERFECTLY. BUT LIZZIE DOESN’T FOCUS IT ON HERSELF... - IT’S WREN!! STANDING THERE! ! IN THE WOODS WITH LIZZIE!

dialogues.speaker: LIZZIE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Now what do I do? - Wren looks into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Just sacrifice something you love. - The video ends. Hallie stares at the dead black screen. Horror on her fac +e HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 111.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... Hallie jumps, the unexpected voice spinning her around. Wren stands in the doorway, afraid to enter the room. Tea stream down from the dark circles under her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: How could you do that?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: It was before I knew what would happen... Wren’s voice breaks, the tears fight against the words. HALLIE’S HORROR QUICKLY TURNS TO ANGER.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Wren, she’s in the hospital!!

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: I didn’t know, I swear. But I think I found a way- Hallie steps to Wren. Full of rage. About to hit her...

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (yells) I came over here because I found something that might stop this!! Hallie stops herself. Just barely.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See for yourself! Wren scrambles to the computer. Hallie just stares at her unconvinced. Suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I went through my conversations with AlleyKat... Wren scrolls to AlleyKat’s last entry. Just random number ON THE SCREEN: “32.903852, -79.988029”

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then look... She clicks on another feed. And another. And another. Hal watches Wren frantically navigate the site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 112.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: You've lost your mind.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: No!! It’s these numbers... ON THE SCREEN: We click through a series of conversations People asking for help. “How do you stop Slender Man!!?” the last entry of each feed... “%32.903852, -79.988029” The anger slowly melts away as Hallie sees each new feed.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then I saw this. ON THE SCREEN: Wren opens a feed from Katie to AlleyKat. Desperately, pleading for help. And AlleyKat’s final entr %32.903852, -79.988029” Wren looks back at Hallie.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I searched it... ON THE SCREEN: Wren searches the random set of numbers in web browser. A MAP POPS UP!! A spot in the middle of nowh

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They aren’t random numbers. They’re coordinates... ON THE SCREEN: Wren zooms all the way in on the map. It zeroes in on a spot in the middle of nowhere. In the wood - A TAGGED LOCATION APPEARS ON THE MAP... “SLENDER MAN’S MANSION” - IT’S JUST A DISTORTED ARRAY OF PIXELS. TREES CLUSTER AR WHAT LOOKS LIKE A STRUCTURE. BUT IT’S IMPOSSIBLE TO TELL.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need to go there.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Come on. Someone hacked in and put that there. It’s a joke...

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What if it’s not? What if there’s a way to save Lizzie. To save all of us. Maybe even Katie. We can take my mom’s car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF  Tan Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 113.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: You wanna go!? Are you crazy!?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: What choice do we have!!? Hallie just stares at the screen. We see something surfac her eyes. A sliver of hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city lights are left behind as they speed down an emp highway. A darkening landscape rolls by as they descend i a sleepy rural area. Wren glances at Hallie. Treading lightly. Tension in air. Hallie doesn’t make eye contact. The anger is still there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights cut through the darkness. A RED SEDAN makes it way down the crumbling country road. The car rolls to a s at a DEAD END. The engine dies and the headlights disappe All we hear is the silence of the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls focus on Wren’s phone. A destination is mapped on the screen. It straight ahead. Past the dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car doors creak open. The girls step out and walk aro to the front of the car.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: It’s through there... Their gaze drifts to the darkness ahead as the wind swell the trees. Leaves rustle on the swaying branches.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Okay... They both flashlight their phones. But as soon as they spotlight the treeline... THEY SEE A GIRL WALKING INTO THE WOODS.  Tan Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 114. The girl holds for a moment. Standing in bare feet and a long, white nightgown. But just as quickly, the girl slip into darkness. Hard to tell, but it looked like Katie!

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Was that...?

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (calling out) Hey!!

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO BEAMS OF LIGHT SPOT THE WAY THROUGH THE DARKNESS.
dialogues.text: Wren and Hallie chase through the trees, branches snaggin and grabbing at their clothes. They stop and aim their flashlights, but the girl is gone.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Goddamnit. Where is she? THEN MOVEMENT UP AHEAD. THE GIRL APPEARS IN THE DISTANCE.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, wait! Wren’s voice echoes through the forest as they chase afte her. Their flashlights sweep through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: WREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come back!! The light from their phones leads them to a dark path in forest. The path widens towards something hidden in darkn A GIANT GNARLED OAK TREE. Hallie and Wren walk towards the tree, searching. As they move closer, something materializes under its branches.

dialogues.speaker: A HUGE, BROKEN DOWN MANSION
dialogues.text: Was it hidden in darkness? Or did it appear out of thin a The towering structure blends into the forest around it. Overgrown. Abandoned. And perched on a crumbling pedestal rock in front of it... A LARGE CAST IRON BELL. Wren and Katie slowly approach the decaying structure. A heavy blanket of silence surrounds them.  Tan Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 115. SUDDENLY, THEY SEE THE GIRL SLIP INSIDE THE FRONT DOOR. She beckons them to follow and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: IT LOOKED LIKE KATIE
dialogues.text: Wren and Hallie call out, running after. They’re right be her, scrambling up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door creaks open in the darkness. Hallie and Wren ste inside, their phones lighting the way.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: Katie... Her voice bounces of the walls and fades away. No respons Only the floorboards creaking under the girls’ feet. THEN A TINY LAUGH SHATTERS THE SILENCE. They spotlight the center of a large open room... AND THE GIRL IS STANDING THERE. FACING AWAY FROM US.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Katie? Is that you? The girl slowly turns around. She looks up at them, dark circles around her eyes... IT’S KATIE!! The girls rush towards her.

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: Katie!! The lights from their phones splash off the walls, light bouncing around the room.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Are you okay? But Katie doesn’t speak.

dialogues.speaker: WREN
dialogues.text: (to Katie) C'mon. Let’s go... Wren grabs Katie’s hand, but she violently pulls away.  Tan Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 116.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Katie, what are you doing? C’mon! Still, she doesn’t move. It’s like she doesn’t even see t

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: We live here now... Katie looks to the ceiling high above their heads.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: With Him... Here in the Absence... Katie looks directly at them.
